loans.name: Salimboy

texts.ru: Салимбою 20 лет. Он проживает с родителями в районе Зафаробод города Истаравшан. По окончании школы Салимбой начал заниматься животноводством. Вот уже два года как он покупает крупно-рогатый скот, откармливает его и затем перепродает. В его деле помогает ему семья. Салимбой очень энергичный молодой человек. Он намерен расширить свою дейтельность и берет кредит для купли-продажи скота. За счет прибыли он хочет увеличить поголовье своего скота.
texts.en:
Salimboy is 20 years old. He lives with his parents in the Zafarobod region, in the town of Istaravshan. After school, Salimboy started raising livestock. For two years already, he has been buying large-horned cattle, feeding them, and then reselling them. This work really helps his family. 

Salimboy is a very energetic, young man. He intends to expand his activities and is taking a loan to buy and sell cattle. With the profit he earns, he wants to increase the number of his livestock.

loans.use: to buy and sell cattle

loans.name: Georgette Marie

texts.fr: Madame Georgette Marie  vit au Sénégal. Elle est mariée et évolue dans le secteur de l’enseignement depuis 5 ans. Ses revenus lui permettent de gérer une partie de ses besoins personnels et d’assurer l’envoie régulier d’argent a ses parents. Elle commence sa journée à 8 heures pour descendre à 13 heures. Elle sollicite un crédit pour la préparation d’un événement  familial. Son projet futur est d’acquérir son propre école.
texts.en:
Georgette Marie lives in Senegal. She is married and working in the education sector for 5 years. With her income she manages her personal needs and sends money regularly to her parents.

Her workday begins at 8:00 a.m. and ends at 1:00 p.m. She is seeking a loan to prepare a family event. Her future goal is to acquire her own school.

loans.use: to prepare a family event.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
Enrique es un cliente recurrente de Kiva, gracias a su crédito anterior pudo mejorar mucho sus servicios y hoy en día ya esta siendo mas conocido y visitado por mas clientes. Agradece mucho por la ayuda que esta recibiendo, ya que así podrá seguir creciendo y ayudando a su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para poder utilizarlo en la compra de un móvil para su trabajo, el cual le ayudará mucho para visitar a clientes que viven lejos, quiere comprarse un modesto auto y así ir creciendo de a poco.
texts.en:
Enrique is a regular Kiva client. Thanks to his previous loan, he was able to improve services and is now better-known and has more customers. He is grateful for the support, which helps him continue to expand and help his family. 

He is applying for a loan to buy a car for work that will let him visit customers who live far away. He wants to buy a no-frills car, which will let him grow his business.

loans.use: to buy a car.

loans.name: Venantie

texts.en:
Venantie is 53. She is married, with four children between 14 and 25.  She sells different items, and has been in the business for fifteen years. 

She is requesting a loan of 350,000 RWF; with the loan, she plans to buy more corn flour and cooking oil for sale. 

With the profits, she would like reinvest in the business so that in the future, she may become a wholesaler.

loans.use: To buy more corn flour and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Edmundo

texts.es: El Sr. Edmundo tiene 28 años y es casado con 2 hijos que son de las edades de  2 y 1 años, el se dedica a la venta de ganado, el vende en las distintas ferias de la ciudad de la ciudad de El Alto, el vive en la localidad de Batallas  y tiene  a su ganado en la cumbre en un terreno que él tiene, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Edmundo va a usar este préstamo para la compra de ganado y después llevar a las distintas ferias, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital, El Sr. Edmundo enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la poca demanda en ocasiones ya sea por problemas de clima o de transporte, desea con el tiempo poder comprar un camión de mayor capacidad para poder transportar mayor cantidad de ganado.
texts.en:
Edmundo, 28, is married and has two children, ages 2 and 1. He sells cattle at different fairs in the city of El Alto. He lives in Batallas, and he raises his livestock on land he owns at the summit. This is his first loan cycle with the institution.

Edmundo will use the loan to buy cattle to later take to different fairs. He needs the loan because he lacks working capital. At times, he has little customer demand due to poor weather or lack of transport, which present challenges to his business. He would like to buy a bigger truck one day to transport more cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Nietaton Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les quatre  femmes du groupe  NIETATON  ont  en moyenne 42 ans et  3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le quartier Hamdallaye de SAN cercle SAN  dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté. Elles font la vente de divers articles et de cosmétiques. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur  13e prêt solidaire.
Madame, Kadia  (1ere  personne debout  de la gauche vers la droite avec foulard blanc au coud) excelle  dans la vente produits cosmétiques. Elle  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter,  2 kg de magnokisseni ½ kg de djekalani et plus de 24 bouteilles de parfum pour la préparation de l’encens. Après avoir faire le mélange pendant plus d’une semaine elle les mets dans les bouteilles de mayonnaise.  Elle s’approvisionne  auprès des grossistes de SAN. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, en détail et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, à domicile  dans les bureaux. 
Avec ce prêt, Madame Kadia  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge des besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The four members of the group NIETATON live in extended traditional families in the Hamdallaye district of San, circle of SAN, region of Segou (4th administrative region of Mali). They average 42 years of age and three children each, and they know one another as neighbors and through ties of marriage and kinship. They sell miscellaneous merchandise and cosmetic products. 

To bolster their working capital, the group members joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This is their 13th group loan. 

Mrs. Kadia (standing first from the left and wearing a white scarf) specializes in the sale of cosmetic products. She plans to use her loan to buy 2 kg of magnokisseni, ½ kg of djekalani and over 24 bottles of perfume to prepare incense. She mixes up the ingredients and after a week or so, she pours the mixture into bottles. She buys her supplies from wholesalers in SAN, and she conducts her sales at retail from her home and in office buildings, for cash or credit, to a clientele consisting of both men and women.

With this loan, Mrs. Kadia expects to earn an average monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA, which she will use to reinvest in her activity and to cover household expenses.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for the preparation of incense.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Мухаббат добрая и порядочная женщина. Ей 49 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2  детей. Мухаббат и ее семья живут в сельской местности и занимаются выращиванием сельхоз культуры. Они имеют 1,5 га земли.  Доход от данного бизнеса не хватает для улучшения условия проживания. В данном бизнесе участвуют все члены семьи, как муж Мухаббата, так и дети. Мухаббат решила организовать новый бизнес для получения дополнительного дохода. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей сухофруктов, так как на местном рынке сухофрукты имеют большой спрос. От полученного дохода она планирует улучшить условию проживания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки товара, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Muhabbat is a kind and decent woman. She is 49 years old. She is married and raising two children. Muhabbat and her family live in a rural area and are engaged in growing crops. They have 1.5 hectares of land. Income from the business is not enough to improve their living conditions. All the members of the famly, Muhabbat's husband and children, are involved in this business. 

Muhabbat decided to start a new business to generate additional income. To that end, she took a course "Bring It On" organized by the Association of Business Women and received a certificate. She wants to establish a business buying and selling dried fruits, as there is great demand for dried fruits in the local market. She plan to use the revenue to improve living conditions. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 somoni to buy goods, to establish a new business.

loans.use: to buy dried fruits for organizing a new business

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela tiene 41 años, está casada con Omar. Ellos tienen un hijo: Aldair, a quien cuidan con esmero. Su casa es propia y se ubica en un anexo rural.
Marcela trabaja casi todos los días para salir adelante. Junto a su esposo siembran semestralmente habas, maíz, choclos y gladiolos, los cuales venden en los mercados de Tarma y La Merced, ya que es ahí donde mejores precios obtienen. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus siembras de las plagas, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es llevar sus cultivos hasta los mercados donde los vende, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados. Para más adelante, espera mejorar sus productos y así obtener mejores precios y está segura de lograrlo, ya que su esposo comenzó con un negocio de compra y venta de diversos productos en la capital del país, donde obtiene buenas ganancias.
Éste mes tiene pensado adquirir semillas de arvejas y maíz para iniciar 2 siembras.
Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Muruhuay” y éste es su crédito número 10 MFP, donde se siente beneficiada en su crecimiento como agricultora. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Marcela podrá comprar  1 bolsa de semillas de arvejas y otra de maíz, para iniciar 2 siembras.
texts.en:
Marcela, 41, is married to Omar.  They have one son: Aldair, whom they lovingly care for. They own their house and it is located in a rural annex. Marcela works almost every day in order to get ahead. She and her husband semiannually sow beans, corn, and gladiolus plants, which they sell in the markets of Tarma and La Merced, since that is where they get the best prices. 

What she likes most about her job is guarding her crops against pests. She has been doing this work for 20 years and she thinks the most difficult part is bringing her crops to the markets where she sells them, since the sacks she carries are very heavy. In the future, she hopes to improve her products and that way  obtain better prices, and she is sure she will achieve this since her husband began a small business buying and selling different products in the country's capitol, where he makes good profits.

This month she is thinking about acquiring pea and corn seeds to begin the sowing. She belongs to the Communal Bank "Señor de Muruhuay” and this is her tenth microfinance loan. She feels that, as a member of this group, she benefits in her growth as a farmer. For this reason she promises to be punctual with her loan payments. Marcela will be able to buy one bag of pea seeds and another of corn seeds, to begin sowing.

loans.use: to buy one bag of pea seeds and another of corn seeds

loans.name: Edlin Lucero

texts.es: La Sra. Edlin tiene 22  años, se dedica a la venta de perfumes y colonias y cosméticos por catalogo,  es promotora de productos de belleza ella vende de manera ambulante visitando instituciones públicas y privadas, barrios distintos domicilios ofreciendo sus productos, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Edlin va a usar este préstamo  para comprar perfumes y colonias por mayor que se encuentran en promoción para tener en stock para su  negocio,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es tener variedad de productos para  satisfacer a sus  clientes, La Sra. Edlin enfrenta retos en su negocio que son atender  con eficiencia a sus clientes y va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida de su familia ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse y salir adelante  sola.
texts.en:
Edlin, 22, sells catalog perfumes, colognes, and cosmetics and is a marketing representative for beauty products. She visits public and private entities and homes in different neighbors to promote her products.

She will use this loan from the institution to buy wholesale perfumes and colognes that are on promotion so that she will have them in stock to satisfy customer demand. The challenge Edlin faces is servicing her customers efficiently. She will use her earnings to improve her family's circumstances, as her business is the only way she has to support them and get ahead on her own.

loans.use: to buy wholesale perfumes and colognes.

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr:
Amy est une femme mariée.Elle est mère de deux filles dont l'une fréquente l'école.Elle s'occupe des taches ménagères à longueur de journée.Depuis deux ans, elle fait de l'embouche bovine en achetant des bœufs qu'elle revend après huit mois.
Cette activité lui rapporte des revenus qui lui permettent de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses deux enfants.
Afin de faire une nouvelle opération, elle sollicite un prêt de 500000f pour acheter deux bœufs. Son ambition est de renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Amy is a married woman. She's the mother of two girls, out of whom one attends school. Amy is taking care of domestic chores all day long. For two years, she's been raising cattle, by purchasing oxen and reselling them after eight months.

This business earns her enough to provide for herself and her two children. For her next fattening operation, she's seeking a loan of XOF 500'000 in order to buy two oxen. She ambitions to strengthen her business.

loans.use: to buy two oxen

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is 35 years old. He is married with one child who is four years old. His wife is his partner in business. He has been in business for 10 years.  He wants a loan to buy more rice, sugar, beans, bananas and many more items to sell. With the profit, he will finish his house.

loans.use: To buy more rice, beans and bananas to sell

loans.name: Shary

texts.ru: Шари трудолюбивая и честная женщина. Ей 46 лет. Всю свою жизнь она проработала на земле, то есть она занималась выращиванием сельхоз культуры, а также скотоводством. Она работала с раннего утра до вечера для благо получения семьи, но ее доход от данного бизнеса не хватала на жизнь и поэтому Шари и ее семья живут бедно. Трое ее детей и муж помогают ей и стараются улучшить условию проживания. Шари посоветовалась с семьей и решила решила организовать новый бизнес для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей сухофруктов. От полученного дохода она планирует улучшить условию проживания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки товара, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Shary is a hardworking and honest woman. She is 46 years old. All her life, she has been working the land, and is engaged in the cultivation of crops and livestock. She worked from early morning to night for the benefit of the family, but her income from this business is not enough to live on, and therefore Shary and her family live in poverty. Her three children and husband help her and they try to improve their living conditions. 

Shary consulted with the family and decided to start a new business to bring the family benefit. To that end, she took a course "Bring It On" organized by the Association of Business Women and received a certificate. Now, she is fully able to establish her own business and to become successful in this field. She wants to organize a business buying and selling dried fruit. She plans to use earned revenue to improve living conditions. 

She is requesting a loan of 3,000 somoni to buy goods for establishing a new business.

loans.use: to buy dried fruits for organizing a new business

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is 28 years old, married, and has one child. 

Filomena is in the agricultural, pig fattening business in the Philippines. Filomena requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and materials for the repair of her pigpens.

Filomena has been pig fattening for two years now and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business. In the future, Filomena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and materials for the repair of her pigpens.

loans.name: Puapuagatia

texts.en:
Puapuagatia is 43 years old and married, with six children. She has a small garden where she grows cabbages, cucumbers, and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. 

Puapuagatia needs a loan to purchase more farming tools and seeds to expand her business. She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SBPD) since 2011. Puapuagatia will use the profits from her sales to save in her account for family needs.

loans.use: to buy farming tools and seeds for her garden, so she can sell vegetables.

loans.name: Musharaf

texts.ru: Мушарафу 50 лет. Она трудолюбивая и честная женщина. Она вдова и имеет 2 детей. После смерти мужа она осталась без кормильца с 2 детьми. Ей было очень трудно справляться с расходами. Она после смерти мужа начала работать на поле, но ее доход был маленький и ей было очень трудно. Так как Мушараф всегда старается обеспечить своих детей хорошим условием проживания, она решила организовать новый бизнес. Таким образом, она хочет найти новый источник дохода. Она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес  купле продажей сухофруктов. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки товара, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Musharaf is 50 years old. She is a hardworking and honest woman. She is a widow and has two children. After the death of her husband, she was left with two children and no breadwinner. It was very difficult to cope with expenses. She began working in the fields, but her income was small and it was very difficult. 

Since Musharaf is always trying to provide her children with good living conditions, she decided to establish a new business. In this manner, she wants to find a new source of income. She took a course "Bring It On" organized by the Association of Business Women and received a certificate. Now she is fully able to establish her own business and to become successful in this sphere. She wants to organize a business buying and selling dried fruit. 

She is requesting a loan of 3,000 somoni to buy goods to establish her new business.

loans.use: to buy dried fruits for organizing a new business

loans.name: Chérita

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale à domicile depuis 1995, chérita âgée de 37ans a pour conjoint un revendeur. Elle est mère de 04 enfants tous allant à l’école. C’est en 1995 qu’elle a démarré son activité et elle sollicite son troisième crédit pour acheter des marchandises (riz, huile végétale, sucre et autre). Elle espère augmenter son chiffre d’affaire et assurer  l’épanouissement de la famille avec le profit qu’elle réalisera.
texts.en: Chérita has been selling general food products from her home since 1995. A 37 year old woman who is married to a re-seller of clothing, she is also the mother of 4 children, all of whom attend school. She is asking for her third loan in order to purchase merchandise (rice, vegetable oil, sugar, and other products). She hopes to increase her sales activity and use future profits to ensure the fulfillment of her family.

loans.use: purchase general food products

loans.name: Elva

texts.es: La Sra. Elva tiene 36 años, tiene tres hijos de las edades de 4, 8 y 12 años, que se encuentran en edad escolar,  ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan, su panadería  que se encuentra ubicado  en la localidad de Mora,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Elva va a usar este préstamo para la compra de material de construcción como tejas para la construcción de un ambiente  para el lugar donde se encuentra su horno, La Sra. Elva es una persona  con ganas de superación se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en:
Señora Elva is 36 years old, and has three school-aged children aged 4, 8 and 12. She makes a living preparing and baking bread, and has a bakery located in the district of Mora.

This loan is her first with the organization. Elva will use it to buy building materials such as tiles to build an area for where her oven is located. Elva is an individual who strives to better herself, and feels happy and grateful for the support given by the organization, since this is her only means of making a living.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Construyendo Futuro Group

texts.es: Claudio tiene 46 años y como muchos de los prestatarios en su grupo, él trabaja en la venta de comestibles. Claudio se dedica a ahumar carne de pollo y cerdo desde hace 3 años. Sus productos son naturales, asi que no usa preservativa o química. El quiere su préstamo para compara mercadería y ahorrar para poder comprar una selladora al vacío y poder entrar a otros mercados. Es una persona muy emprendedora y visionaria que va viendo las necesidades de sus clientes y de acuerdo a eso va invirtiendo en su negocio. En el futuro Claudio espera poder formalizar, crecer, y diversificar su negocio y por supuesto, dar opciones de trabajo a otras personas, asi para perfeccionar su negocio. A nivel personal, el quiere apoyar  a otras personas a mejorar sus productos o servicios para en fin, apoyar a su comunidad. Claudio es papa soltero, con hijos 24 y 17, profesional el mayor y la menor entra a estudiar este año. A él le gusta trabajar con MFI, Fondo Esperanza por la oportunidad que le han dado de poder salir adelante, conocer más personas e integrarse. Claudio aparece al mano izquierda con las manos arriba.
texts.en:
Claudio is 46, and sells prepared foods like many of the other group members. For three years, Claudio has been smoking chicken and pork meat. His products are natural and contain no preservatives or chemicals. He would like a loan to buy merchandise and a vacuum sealing machine in order to sell at other markets. He is enterprising and looks to the future to anticipate his customers' needs to invest in his business.

Claudio expects to plan, grow, diversify, and improve his business, and, of course, offer employment to others. On a personal level, he wants to help others to improve their products or services as a way to support his community. 

Claudio is the single father of two children, ages 24 and 17. His older child is a professional, and the younger one will start his studies this year. Claudio likes working with MFI Fondo Esperanza because he has been given the chance to get ahead, meet more people, and become a group member. He appears on the left in the photo with his hands raised.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and to buy a vacuum sealing machine in order to sell at other markets.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
Velentina, es separada  tiene tres hijos, viven en casa propia, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Bautista Savedra de la ciudad de El Alto.

Ella estudió hasta el nivel primario y actualmente comercializa material de construcción de manera independiente.

El crédito lo requiere para comprar material de construcción, fierro, vigas de madera, calamina para techo ya que construirá una habitación en su casa, así podrá brindar a su familia mayor comodidad.

El sueño  de  Valentina es tener una casa donde sus hijos tengan habitaciones propias y cómodas.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Valentina is separated, has three children, and lives in her own home, located in the Bautista Savedra area of the city of El Alto.

She left school after primary education and is currently self-employed, selling building materials.

She needs this loan to buy building materials such as metal, wooden beams, and corrugated iron for roofing, since she plans to build another room in her home in order to make it more comfortable for her family.

Valentina's dream is to have a home where her children each have their own comfortable bedroom.

This is her first loan with IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to buy metal, wooden beams, and corrugated iron for roofing to build another room in her home, so that it is more comfortable for her family

loans.name: Luis Angel

texts.es: Luis Angel, tiene la edad de 21 años,  vive en  un unión libre y no tiene hijos. El quiere asistir área que tiene sembrada, comprar insumos y abono.   Tiene varios años que se dedica a su finca y quiere crecer y también desea que su finca sea muy productiva. Es el segundo  préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. No  ha realizado otros préstamos en bancos estatales o Cooperativas, pero FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja. El  también tiene el deseo de brindarle a su compañera mejor calidad de vida y para él también.
texts.en: Luis Angel is 21, lives in a common-law marriage, and has no children. He wants to treat his plantings and buy supplies and fertilizer. He has worked his farmland for several years, and he wants to grow his business and make the land more productive. This is his second loan cycle with FUDECOSUR. Though he has never had state or cooperative loans, FUDECOSUR offered him excellent terms and very low interest rates. He also hopes to improve his and his partner's standard of living.

loans.use: to grow coffee.

loans.name: Enora

texts.en:
Enora is a 33-year-old, married woman from Duero, Bohol, Philippines and a mother of two children. She has been engaged in a vegetable gardening business for more than three years. Her husband also works as a farmer. 

Enora is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides. With this, she will be able to improve her vegetable farm, thus augmenting her harvest and, eventually, her yield and profit.

In the future, Enora hopes to improve her business and save money, so that she can continue to support the needs of her family, especially the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides for her vegetable farm.

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en:
Leonita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a gasoline business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase additional gasoline to sell in her business.

Leonita has been in this business for four years. Leonita also earns income from buying and selling charcoal.

Leonita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline to sell

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en: Jonalyn is a responsible mother who assists her husband by generating income. She is 30 years old and has two infant-age children. Due to the hardship of living, Jonalyn engages in buying and selling fruits and vegetables to supplement her husband's income. She aims to strengthen the business to generate sufficient income. She is asking for an additional of PHP 10,000.00 to buy more stocks of vegetables like beans, onions, potatoes, garlic, cabbage and tomatoes to sell. She hopes that this loan will help her to improve the business and that someday, she will become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of vegetables like beans, onions, potatoes, garlic, cabbage and tomatoes to sell

location.town: Brgy. Don Mariano Perez, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Iftikhar Ahmed

texts.en:
Mr. Iftikhar, age 47, operates a business of buying and selling rexine foam and poshish material. He purchases a variety of material from the factory and sells them in the main market. He has been operating his business since 2002. He and his wife have five children and live in Lahore. His wife is a very hard-working and responsible homemaker. 

Iftikhar has requested for a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan in order to purchase a variety of material for his business. As this business is the only source of income for the family, he dreams of making it as successful as he can. He is hopeful that this loan will be productive for his business and beneficial for his family's future. 

He is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase rexine foam and poshish material to offer for sale

loans.name: Nadir Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NADIR”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Soraya es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, venta de cosméticos, venta de joyería, venta de comida, venta de frazadas, venta de zapatos, venta de pollos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Soraya es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia hace varios años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa) que adquirirá de las Ciudades de la Paz y Oruro y posteriormente las comercializa en la ciudad de Potosí. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones del área de salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Nadir" will begin its second cycle with Pro Mujer, part of the regional office in Collpani. It is made up of eight members and managed by a board of directors of which Soraya is the president.

The types of businesses from the communal bank are varied, among them there are: clothing sales, cosmetics sales, jewelry sales, food vendors, blanket sales, shoe sales, and chicken vendors.

The loan that they will receive will benefit the small businesses where Soraya is a member. She says she joined Pro Mujer two years ago at the invitation of a friend who is a member.

Currently, she has her own business selling clothing; she learned this business on her own over the past few years. The loan she is now requesting is to increase her capital (purchase of clothing) that she will acquire in the cities of La Paz and Oruro. Afterwards, she will sell them in the city of Potosí.

This kind of work enables her to earn enough resources to sustain her home. She lives with her husband, and has three children. When you ask what she likes about Pro Mujer, Soraya responds that she likes the health trainings offered.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase agricultural supplies and fertilizer.

loans.name: Jennylyn

texts.en: Jennylyn is 27 years old and single. She works very hard to help her parents. Jennylyn runs a general store in the Philippines and has applied for a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell, including snack foods, soft drinks, canned goods, eggs and noodles. Jennylyn has been in this business for six years. In the future, Jennylyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her store, including snack foods, soft drinks, canned goods, eggs and noodles.

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma is 43 years old, married and has five children who are in school. 

Lerma is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Lerma requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Lerma has been farming rice for eight years now, and has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Lerma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Cristopher

texts.en: Cristopher is 38 years old, married and has four children. They live in La Suerte. Cristopher is a responsible father who is busy managing a hog-raising business. He spends his income on his family's daily needs, such as paying his children's tuition fees and paying the electricity bill. Cristopher is requesting a loan of 27,000 PHP to purchase hog feed and vitamins. He hopes to increase his profits so that he can meet the financial needs of the family and save money for the future. He believes that, through his patience in managing his business, he will be able to improve the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase hog feed and vitamins

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana is 43 years old, married, and has four children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for eight years. Diana needs a loan to buy a sack of onions, a bag of flour, sacks of rice, and soft drinks. She hopes to use her profits for the betterment of her children’s education. She became a member of SPBD to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy onions, sugar, salt, snacks and soft drinks to sell in her store.

loans.name: Ali Asghar

texts.en:
Ali Asghar is 28 years old a very hard-working person. He lives in Lahore, Pakistan with his family. He is a responsible father of two children. 

Since 2002, Ali Asghar has been running a butcher shop in the main market as the only source of income for the family. He has requested for a loan of 100,000 PKR to purchase products for the butcher shop. 

He will increase his business if he gets a good amount of profit. He is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: To purchase products for the butcher shop.

loans.name: Tuty

texts.en:
Tuty is starting up a business of buying and selling dried fruits. Her husband is a farmer and they have two children. Tuty is a kind, hard-working person, and until now she has always worked with her husband on the farm, but after having taken the "To Get Ahead" training course for women, she is eager to start her own business. The course has taught her the skills needed to start this venture, and her husband will help her operate it.

Tuty is requesting a loan in the amount of 3,000 Somoni in order to buy dried fruits to organize her new business. She is confident that her loan funds will enable her to make her new venture a success and a profitable source of income. 

Her goal is to offer her family a better quality of life and improved financial opportunities. 

She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy dried fruits to start up her new business

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
This is Edna. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to buy materials needed in her manicure/pedicure business. Her earnings were a big help in the education of her children, and in her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy different products needed for her business, like nail polish, cuticle remover, cuticle pushers, nail cutters and other materials.The profits from her business will definitely help her sustain her family's daily needs, as well as the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Edna dreams of having a good a life, and giving her children a good education. She hopes that her business will expand. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and to draw strength and inspiration from studing the word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for nail polish, cuticle remover, pusher, nail cutter and other materials needed in her nail business.

loans.name: Bebian

texts.en:
Bebian operates a motorcycle transport business. She works hard to support her family and earns additional income from food vending. She and her husband have four children.

Bebian has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She is currently requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000 through NWTF, which she will use to buy spare parts and other equipment for the repair of her motorcycle and the upkeep of her transport business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other equipment for the repair of her motorcycle

loans.name: Conception

texts.en:
Conception is 54 years old, married with two children.  

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Conception has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for six years, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Conception would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ceferina

texts.en:
This is Ceferina, 55, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ruben and a mother to their children. She and her husband manage their household while operating a business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ceferina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. 

Ceferina earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects an expansion in her business income as she enlarges her business. 

Ceferina hopes to expand her business and dreams to have a peaceful life. Every week, she faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Oscar Andres

texts.es: Oscar Andrés, tiene la edad de 18 años, es soltero y vive con sus padres. El  necesita la moto para trasladarse a la finca de café que tiene su padre que está lejos de su casa. El trabaja con su padre.   Tiene varios años que se dedica a la finca y quiere crecer y también desea que la finca sea muy productiva. Es el primer  préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. No  ha realizado otros préstamos en bancos estatales o Cooperativas, pero FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja. El  también tiene el deseo de brindarle a su familia mejor calidad de vida y para él también.
texts.en: Oscar Andrés is 18 years old, single and lives with his parents.  He works on his father’s coffee farm and he needs a motorcycle for transportation because the farm is far from their home. He has been farming for several years now and he wants the farm to grow and become very productive. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR. He has not had any other loans through state or communal banks, but FUDESCOSUR has given him a loan with an easy payment plan and a much lower interest rate. He would like to provide a better quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Tsetsegmaa

texts.en: Mrs. Tsetsegmaa, 50 years old, lives with her husband and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working at a private business entity since 2002 and, in 2007, she began working as a bookkeeper. Her husband has been working as a driver at the same entity since 2001. Her daughter was employed as a field manager in 2012. Even though the family owns a house on their own land, they live in a traditional Mongolian ger (portable felt tent). Because the house has no heating system, the family chills down to the core in wintertime. So she is requesting a loan of 1,200,000 MNT to install a heating system in the floor of house. The installation of the heating system will permit the family to burn less coal, thus contributing to the efforts to combat air pollution. The borrower is a very hard-working individual who wants to move with her family into their house before the traditional Mongolian holiday known as White Moon Comes.

loans.use: to install a heating system in her home.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 38 years old, married, and has six children who are currently going to school. Florence is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Florence requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy seed, fertilizers and other farm supplies. Florence has been growing vegetables for 15 years, and she has borrowed from NWTF eight times in the past to sustain the farm. In the future, Florence would like to save enough money so she can afford to finish her children’s college education.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
Mahbuba is 47 years old, married, and has two children. She always wanted to provide them with a good education and since her husband’s income is not enough to provide the family with a good quality of life,  she decided to start new business selling dried fruits. 

Mahbuba is requesting a loan for 3,000 Somoni, which she will use to buy dried fruits.  She studied the course ‘To get ahead’ for women's organizations where she learned business skills.  Her daughter will help her with business.

loans.use: to purchase dried fruits.

loans.name: Irenea

texts.en:
Irenea is 49 years old, married, and has six children. Irenea works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and has applied for a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as shampoo and groceries to sell in her store. Irenea has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 25 years and also earns an income from food vending.
Irenea aspires to save enough money so that she will be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.en:
Arturo, age 54, raises hogs to earn an income. He lives in La Suerte, Angadanan, with his wife and their two children. He is a responsible father and works hard to manage his business. He applies his income toward supporting his family's daily needs, paying his children's tuition fees, and paying utility bills.

Arturo is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 28,000,  which he will use to purchase feed and vitamins for his hogs. He hopes to increase his profits so that he can meet the financial needs of the family and save money for the future. 

Arturo believes that his patience and good business management will enable him to improve the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for his hogs

loans.name: Myleine

texts.en:
Myleine is a food vendor from Jagna, Bohol. She has been engaged in her food vending business for several years now, selling home-cooked snack foods to members of the community. She and her husband have two children. 

Myleine is requesting a loan in order to buy ingredients needed for preparing her snack foods, such as flour, sugar, milk, butter, margarine, and cooking oil. With this investment, she will be able to cook and sell more food to her customers.
 
In the future, Myleine hopes to expand her business in order to make it as successful as possible.

loans.use: to buy ingredients needed for preparing her snack foods, such as flour, sugar, milk, butter, margarine, and cooking oil

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 45 years old and married, with three children. With two children in school, Emelia works very hard to provide for them.

Emelia runs a direct beauty products business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more stocks to sell, like lotion, soap, and shampoo.

Emelia has been in this business for 22 years. In the future, Emelia would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell, like lotion, soap, and shampoo.

loans.name: Mamerta

texts.en:
Mamerta works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 26 years.

Mamerta has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fruit like apples, oranges, mangos, etc ...to sell in her fruit stand.

In the future, Mamerta would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruit like apples, oranges, mangos, etc... to sell in her fruit stand.

loans.name: Bladimir Lenin

texts.es:
Bladimir es un hombre de 25 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Aguaytia con sus padres y hermanos, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para solventar sus gastos, Bladimir no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Mecánica que deseaba, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Escabeche de Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Bladimir trabaja en su pequeño negocio de tapizado de motos y mototaxis, él trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, él se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Bladimir se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de materiales e implementos, tales como martillos, pinzas, hilos adhesivos, tachuelas, elásticos, aislantes y otros, de esta manera contará con las herramientas necesarias para desarrollar su labor, así pues Bladimir seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para salir adelante y lograr su gran sueño de ampliar su negocio y tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Bladimir is a 25 year old man. He is single and lives in the city of Aguaytia with his parents and brothers. He is a very kind, hard-working and enthusiastic person that has a great dream of triumph; unfortunately due to a lack of economic resources and the need to work to support himself, Bladimir was not able to study the professional Mechanical Engineering career that he desired, be he would have liked very much to be able to do it. In his free time he likes to play football with his friends and sometime cook a rich "Escabeche de Pollo" or Marinated Chicken to share with his family.

On his own initiative, with much determination and dedication, Bladimir works in his small business of motorcycle and motorcycle taxi upholstery. He works every day from very early in the morning and can work for roughly 10 hours. He likes doing his job and believes that it is going well due to good prices and the kind treatment that he provides to his customers.
Bladimir is very grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the help provided he will be able to purchase materials and tools such as hammers, pliers, wire adhesives, tacks, elastic, and insulation etc. In this way he will be with the necessary tools to do his job, and Bladimir will continue working and striving to succeed and achieve his great dream of growing his business and having his own home.

loans.use: to purchase materials and tools such as hammers, pliers, wire ahesives, tacks, etc.

loans.name: Seke Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SEKE”  iniciará el decimo noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Silveria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de fruta, trenzado de mantas, venta de camas, comercio de api, elaboración de calzados.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Silveria es integrante, ella indica que hace siete años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una de las asesoras de crédito de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de su madre, hace varios años, posteriormente decide abrir su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, fideo y verduras) que adquirirá de las ferias de la cuidad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto fijo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones del área de salud.
texts.en:
The “SEKE” community association will begin its nineteenth cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Collpani. It is made up of nine members and managed by a Board, with Señora Silveria as President. The members of the community association make a living in various areas, including selling food, selling fruit, braiding blankets, selling beds, selling api, a non-alcoholic maize drink, and making shoes.

The loan they are requesting will benefit micro-entrepreneurs, including Señora Silveria. She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for seven years. She was invited to be a member by one of the organization's credit counselors, who went to visit her in her home. 

She currently has a business selling food. She says that she learned about this business from her mother, some years ago. Later, she decided to set up her own business.
 
She will use the loan that she is requesting now to increase her capital (buying rice, pasta, and vegetables) which she will purchase from markets in the city of El Alto. Then, after building it, she will sell them on her stall. This work allows her to make money in order to support her family, as she has a partner and three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said that she likes the health training it provides.

loans.use: to buy pasta, rice, and vegetables.

loans.name: Rana M. Riaz

texts.en:
Rana M. Riaz, age 42, is a hard-working man who operates a general store in Lahore. He and his wife are the responsible parents of three children, and his shop is the only source of income for the family. 

At present, the stock of his business is almost depleted. For this reason, he has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan, which he will use to purchase a variety of products for the store. The loan funds will be used to buy such items as oil, rice, sugar, milk, and shampoo. This investment will help him to continue his small business and to satisfy the demands of his clients. 

Despite going through a very tough time at present, and despite all the difficulty experienced by his family, he always tries to be happy because he has a firm belief on Allah Almighty, knowing that he will resolve all his problems some day. He dreams of a bright future for his children.

He is confident that the requested loan will be productive for his business and beneficial for his family. 

He is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRCA Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products for the store

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is 54 years old and married with six children.

Luisa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell at her store.

Luisa has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from raising livestock and farming vegetables.

Luisa aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Changawa's Group

texts.en: Changawa is a farmer, husband and father of two. Changawa's wife is also a farmer; they grow maize, raise animals and trade charcoal. He says unpredictable market prices is a major challenge to his business. Changawa decided to join KOMAZA to increase the forest cover in his dryland community; he understands and appreciates the benefit of having forests to attract rain to dry environments. Changawa wants to use the profit he makes from his KOMAZA tree farm to educate his children and have a good house for his family. Also pictured are another Changawa, who is already a member of a Kiva group, and James, an old KOMAZA farmer who already has two tree farms and was present to support the new farmers as they sign up for the microforestry program.

loans.use: to purchase inputs such as eucalyptus seedlings and fertilizer, as well as to pay for technical trainings and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria works hard to support her family. Gregoria is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Gregoria requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

Gregoria has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Gregoria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Joan

texts.en: Joan is a responsible mother and housewife who operates a hollow blocks manufacturing business to support her family's needs. She is 29 years old and has one child. At this moment, she feels very anxious because she cannot afford to fill the orders of her customers, and a customer is the lifeblood of her business.  In this regard, Joan requested a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase cement and stones to make hollow blocks. She just hopes that her requested loan will be approved in order to fill the orders of her loyal customers.

loans.use: to purchase cement and stones

loans.name: Shierly

texts.en:
This is Shierly. Her previous loan was a big help in her gardening business. She was able to buy the needed gardening materials and supplies for her garden. She has been engaged in this business for 10 years now and it has enabled her to offer her family a great deal of financial help. She and her husband are working hard to continuously provide for their family.

She would like to apply for another PhP 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy gardening materials like wire and baskets, and supplies such as seed and fertilizer. Her profits from his business will be a great help to her in sustaining her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Shierly dreams of having a good life and hopes that her business will continue to expand. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meetings, where she can draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy gardening materials like wire and baskets, and supplies such as seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 41 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Susan is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Susan has been pig fattening for four years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Joseph's Group

texts.en:
Joseph is the leader of Joseph's Group. He is a 44-year-old, married father of nine children. His wife is a farmer like him and they are currently sending five of their children to school. 

Joseph and his wife farm maize, cowpeas, and coconut trees. He looks forward to having a KOMAZA tree farm, so that he may educate all his children and build a house for his family, as well as buy a plot of land to expand his agricultural businesses. 

The loan helps Joseph purchase inputs such as eucalyptus seedlings and fertilizer, as well as to pay for technical training and plantation maintenance support.

loans.use: to purchase inputs such as eucalyptus seedlings and fertilizer, as well as to pay for technical training and plantation maintenance support.

loans.name: Khadbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Khadbaatar, age 36, earns an income from raising livestock and from offering transportation services. He lives with his mother in Darkhan, the second-largest city in Mongolia. They reside in their own house on a plot of land. His mother has retired from work and now gets a pension from the state. 

Mr. Khadbaatar and his mother raise livestock, which they use both as a food source and as goods of sale. Mr. Khadbaatar has been rendering transportation services since 2006, operating between the trade center and outlying towns. 

With his previous loan, he purchased hay-making equipment and upgraded his automobile by purchasing spare parts. 

He is currently requesting a loan in the amount of 5,800,000 MNT, which he will use to purchase a natural-gas vehicle to be used for transportation. Compared to gasoline and diesel engines, natural gas vehicles emit cleaner carbon and lower particulate emissions per equivalent distance traveled. As a result, as a person who worries about his living environment, he feels that the purchase of this car will greatly contribute to the efforts against air pollution. 

This borrower is one of our most reliable clients. He is a very hard-working individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase a natural-gas vehicle to be used for his transportation business

loans.name: Villamor

texts.en: Villamor is from the village of La Suerte in the town of Angadanan. He is 45 years old and is married to Ovelyn. To generate income, Villamor is engaged in the hog-raising business, while his wife is busy selling vegetables in their village. They work hard to meet their daily needs. At this time, Villamor is asking a loan in the amount of PHP 25,000 to buy feed, vaccines, and vitamins for his hogs. He hopes that he can obtain his desired loan to sustain the needs of his hogs.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, and vitamins for his hogs

loans.name: Ceria 2 Group

texts.en:
Triasmawati, age 38, is a leader of the Ceria 2 Group. Triasmawati sells bed linens from her house. She provides several options to choose from in her house such as mats and carpets (merchandise from other to be sold). She has had this business for three years. She has gained regular customers over the years.

Triasmawati (the woman who is raising her hand in the picture) is selling bed linens on credit. She plans to use her loan to buy bed linens and pay her child's exam fee.  In the future she has plans to add clothes to her merchandise. From this profit she can provide for her children's needs. Triasmawati has three children still going to school.

loans.use: to buy bed linens to sell and pay her child's exam fee

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
This is Lolita, 48, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is already a widow and a mother to her child. She manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lolita operates a bakery. Breads and spreads are staples in the usual Filipino cuisine, and are used mostly for breakfast and snacks. The most popular type of bread is the Pandesal, a Filipino version of the Spanish Pan de Sal or salted bread. It is baked during the wee hours of the morning and sold steaming hot to early commuters, students and workers. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy raw supplies like flour, sugar, and butter, which she needs to continue production and expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Lolita hopes to have another branch and dreams of having another vehicle. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for ingredients to bake bread and for the maintenance of her oven.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is a hard-working entrepreneur who operates a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 36 years. She earns an additional income from buying and selling fermented shrimp.

Alicia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She has successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan in order to further build her fishing venture. She is requesting PhP 16,000 through NWTF, which she will use to purchase fish netting, hooks, and other fishing equipment for her business.

She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish netting, hooks, and other fishing equipment for her business

loans.name: Suma Chuyma Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SUMA CHUYMA”  iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Placida es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de sandwichs, tienda de barrio, venta de vestidos, venta de comida, venta de refrescos, venta de salchipapas, librería, venta de celulares.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Placida es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió al percibir la carencia de este servicio en su zona.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de enlatados, aceites, conservas) que adquirirá de las empresas distribuidoras y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y los ahorros
texts.en:
The “SUMA CHUYMA” community association will begin its fourth cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Los Andes. It is made up of eight members, and managed by a Board, with Señora Placida as President. The members of the community association work in various areas, including selling sandwiches, a neighborhood store, selling dresses, selling food, selling drinks, selling hot dogs, a stationary store and selling mobile phones.

The lean they receive will benefit micro-entrepreneurs such as Señora Placida. She sells that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for two years, and joined after being invited by a friend who was a member of the organization. At the moment, she has a local store. She explains that she opened this business when she noticed the lack of this service in her neighborhood.
 
The loan she is now requesting will be used to increase her capital (buying canned goods, oils and preserves), which she will purchase from distribution companies and then sell in her store. This work enables her to earn a living and support her family as much as possible, as she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the health and savings part.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, oils and preserves.

loans.name: Kambizi's Group

texts.en:
Kambizi, age 67, is a farmer. She and her husband have raised one child. Her husband is now too old to work, so Kambizi farms maize, cowpeas, and cassava for their own consumption. Kambizi is pictured with her hand raised.

Because of the challenges brought on by drought, subsistence farming does not generate a sufficient income for Kambizi to live off. She has therefore joined the KOMAZA microforestry program so that she can earn her own money to support herself and her husband. 

She will use her loan funds to purchase tree farm inputs, such as eucalyptus seedlings and fertilizer, as well as to pay for technical training and maintenance support.

With the income from her tree farm, Kambizi would like to build a house, purchase food, and provide for her family. Her favorite part of the KOMAZA program is "the way KOMAZA improves people's lives and the way the staff are doing their work."

loans.use: to purchase tree farm inputs, such as eucalyptus seedlings and fertilizer, as well as to pay for technical training and maintenance support

loans.name: Ganesh

texts.en:
Ganesh is involved in the activity of making and selling brass vessels in his village, he also supplies them to the market near to his village. He has been engaged in this activity for the past 3 years. Ganesh is a 25-year-old differently-abled person living with his parents in a village of Attabira in Odisha.

He makes brass bowls, plates, glasses, spoons etc. and sells them to the dealers of vessels in the market. He has a plan to expand his business by setting up new machinery in his workshop for manufacturing vessels at a faster rate and hiring a small workforce to help.

He has applied for a loan of 15,000 Indian Rupees (INR) for purchasing new machinery. He wants to renovate his house and save money for future unfortunates.

loans.use: to purchase new machinery for his workshop and hire workforce for his vessels manufacturing business.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie, age 25, oversees and owns the operations of a motorized tricycle transportation business. Her business partner is her husband Angelito. They have one motorized tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to Elvie. Her regular customers are members of the local community. She earns a minimum of PhP 500 every day.

Elvie and Angelito live in Silang, Cavite, with their children. They help each other in managing the household and work hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses.  

To help her continue operations of her business, Elvie is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 24,000. She will be utilizing the loan funds to buy spare parts and accessories as well as to pay for maintenance on the vehicle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Elvie dreams of the expansion of her business and hopes to have a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and accessories as well as to pay for maintenance on the motorized tricycle

loans.name: Las Viacheñas De Soboce Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS VIACHEÑAS DE SOBOCE”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Francisca es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: artesanía en mantas, venta de comida, tejido de mantas, costura de polleras, venta de leche y queso, venta de calzados.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Francisca es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de trenzado de mantas; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de su madre, ya que ella le ayudaba en el negocio a su familia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de flecos para el trenzado de mantas) que adquirirá de las ferias de la cuidad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones del área de salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Las Viacheñas de Soboce” will start their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer. They are working with one of the organizations regional offices in Cascada.  The group is made up of seven members and has a board of directors with Francisca as the president. The members of the communal bank engage in different business activities such as blanket crafting, food sales, blanket weaving, skirt making, milk and cheese sales and shoe sales. 

The loan requested will benefit micro-businesses such as Francisca’s. She says that she is a new member of Pro Mujer and that she joined because the organizer of the association visited her at home and asked to her to join. She currently has a business making blankets. She says that she used to help her mother in the family business and that is how she learned this business.

She will use the loan to increase her capital. She will purchase materials for making blankets at the market in the city of El Alto. After they are made she will sell them on request. This work allows her to generate income so she and her spouse can maintain their household

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said that she likes the health and loan training classes.

loans.use: purchase materials for making blankets.

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina is married and has one child.  She works hard to support her family.  She has a food business in the Philippines.  She earns additional income from raising pigs. 

Justina is requesting her fifth loan from NWTF for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy ingredients for her food selling business.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita, age 39, has been engaged in her farming business for more than 14 years. She and her husband, also a farmer, have three young children and live in Bohol.

Teresita is requesting a loan in order to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides for the farm. 

In the future, Teresita hopes to make her business a success. Furthermore, she aims to save enough money to support her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Farayda

texts.en: Hog-raising is the primary source income of Farayda, a mother who is willing to work hard for her family. She is 58 years old and has six children. Farayda is a widow. She says being a single parent is very difficult but Farayda still does her best to meet their daily needs. To this end, she is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 15,000 to buy feed and vaccines for the proper growth of her hogs. Farayda hopes to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for the proper growth of her hogs

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
This is Lilia. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy all the needed items for her variety store. Her business has been running for six years now and it keeps on growing. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday expenses. 

She would like to apply for another PHP 10,000 loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add in her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lilia hopes that her variety store will soon be a grocery store and dreams to have a happy and peaceful life. Weekly, she faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from studying the Word of God. 

* All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 18 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past two years, she has been working hard to manage her small food market. 

To help expand her business, Amina is requesting a loan from BRAC Uganda for 300,000 Ugandan Shillings, which she will use to buy more food items, such as bananas and cassava. The loan will help Amina generate greater profits and buy basic needs for her family as well as save for future use. Amina hopes that in the future she will be able to increase her income. 

Amina is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase bananas and cassava to sell.

loans.name: Nuevo Día Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVO DÍA”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por doce integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rieni es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: comercio de tejido de mantas, venta de carne, costura de mandiles, comercio de arena, venta de comida, elaboración de colchones, venta de mantas, constructor, tejido de chompas a máquina, venta de verduras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rieni es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de arena; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de su cuñado hace años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arena) que adquirirá de las comunidades rurales y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The “NUEVO DÍA” (New Day) community association will begin its first cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Los Andes. It is made up of twelve members, and is managed by a Board, with Señora Rieni as President. The members of the community association make a living in various areas, including a blanket weaving business, selling meat, making aprons, selling sand, selling food, making mattresses,selling blankets, building, weaving sweaters with a machine, and selling vegetables.

The loan that they receive will benefit micro-entrepreneurs such as Señora Rieni. She says that this is the first time she has joined Pro Mujer. She was invited to become a member by a friend who is a member of the organization. At the moment, she has a business selling sand. She says that her sister-in-law taught her about this business years ago.
 
She will use the loan that she is requesting to increase her capital (buying sand), which she will purchase from rural communities and then sell in her store. This work enables her to make a living and support her family as much as possible, as she lives with her partner and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she explained that she likes the health aspects.

loans.use: to buy sand.

loans.name: Rati

texts.en:
