She hopes to get this loan amount in order to become popular and earn greater income so she can secure her family's future and obtain a better way of  living someday.

loans.use: to buy stocks of garments, dress accessories, buttons, zippers, garters and some thread for her dress shop

loans.name: Boyukaga

texts.en:
Boyukaga is a 38 year-old man who is married and has three children. He is a market vendor and sells spare parts for cars in a rented garage. He has eight years of experience in this field. He is doing his business alone and nobody helps him. He chose spare parts which are in high demand, particularly for Russian cars and for Mercedes. His monthly income is 400 AZN.  In this region, it is hard to find quality spare parts because most of them are expensive and hard to find. Boyukaga wants to change the current situation and start selling this kind of product. 

He applied for 1200 AZN to make a small renovation to his shop and to purchase expensive spare parts to meet the demand of customers.

loans.use: to buy expensive spare parts

loans.name: Alde

texts.en: Alde is a 61 year-old married woman and a mother of three grown children from Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in the hog-raising business for more than ten years now. Alde is asking for a loan worth 8000PHP to buy feeds and supplements for the pigs. In the future, Alde hopes to make her business a success and augment her income.

loans.use: to buy feeds and supplements

loans.name: Haya

texts.en: With her previous loan, Haya was able to pay for her semester fees.  Now she is applying for another educational loan that will also supports her in paying for the next semester fees.

loans.use: to pay her semester fees

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 40 years old.  She is married and has four children, three of whom are in school.  Grace is in the agricultural business, buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Grace requested a PHP 20,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock to sell.

Grace has been buying and selling livestock for seven years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF.  Grace successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her livestock business.  In the future, Grace would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Hay

texts.en:
Hay is 28 years old.  She is married and has two dependent children. She resides with her family in a small thatched house that is located in Roung Kou village, Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. She has been cultivating her 1.5 hectares of farm land for more than 10 years. It’s quite hard work for her.  However, she is happy to see her farming business going well. Encouraging and supporting her two children in school is her lifetime wish. Hay’s husband helps her manage their farm in the rainy season and spends the rest of his time working as a paid laborer for extra income.

Hay’s husband decided to go to Thailand, where he can earn a higher income than in Cambodia. But he doesn’t have money for a passport. In this regard, Hay would like to obtain a loan of KHR 3,000,000 to pay for a passport, so she can help her husband to work in the neighboring country legally. She hopes that her income will be improved to sustain her living needs and she can continue to be involved in other types of business pursuits.

loans.use: to pay for a passport, so she can help her husband to work in the neighboring country legally.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en: Joan is 36 years old and has three school-age children. She is engaged in buying and selling dried fish in their village to help her husband in generating income. She aims to improve the business and increase her income in order to cover their necessities and support the education of her children. In this regard, she is asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy additional stocks of dried fish and fish sauce to sell. She is hoping that this loan will help her improve the business and hoping that she will make it more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of dried fish and fish sauce to sell

loans.name: Mwachupa

texts.en:
Mwachupa is from Tiribe, Kenya. He makes a living buying and selling women's, men's and children's clothing. He is married.  His wife is a housewife and takes care of their four children. Mwachupa and his wife live together in their own house along with the children. He is a very hardworking man with very good references. 

Mwachupa is requesting this loan in order to buy clothing.  He wants to offer a better variety of clothing to his customers. He is very grateful for this opportunity and notes that it will be a great help to him.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Aya

texts.en:
Aya is a 23-year-old conservative married lady, so she asked her husband, for whom she is taking this loan, to appear in the photo instead.

Aya's husband works and studies at the same time. He wants to get his degree so he can find better jobs in the future. 

Aya is applying for this educational loan to help her husband in paying for his upcoming semester fees and to support him in his studies, so they can properly raise their baby.

loans.use: to pay for her husband's semester fees.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is 33 years old, married, and has two children who are in school.

Felicidad is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock for her business.

Felicidad has been raising livestock for six years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Felicidad would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock for her business.

loans.name: Nedaa

texts.en:
Nedaa is a 21-year-old conservative single lady, so she asked her one year younger sister, Rawan, to take her place in the photo.

Both Nedaa and Rawan go to college to study, but Nedaa is the one who also works and has a separate income. For that, Nedaa decided to take this loan to help her family and for her and her sister's semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her and her sister's semester fees.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
This is Virginia. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more clothes and shirts for children, men and women. She has been in this business for ten years now, and it keeps on growing. She and her husband, who is a technician, work hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

She would like to apply for another loan, this time for 20,000 PHP, to buy more stock of clothes for children, men and women. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Virginia dreams of expanding her business and having more stalls. She hopes to have good health and a good life for her family. She faithfully meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of merchandise, like children's, men's and women's clothing needed in her business.

loans.name: Sang'alo C Group

texts.en:
Sang'alo C is a group of ten farmers from Bungoma South District represented by John. The group has nine women and one man. John is on the right in the photo with his hand raised. Farming inputs consisting of the materials necessary to plant half an acre of maize, millet, and sorghum will be delivered to John on credit. John joined One Acre Fund during the "long rains" season in 2010 and is now enrolling for the "long rains" 2013 season. John joined One Acre Fund so that he could gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and grow enough food for his family.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, John was only able to harvest three bags of maize per acre, but after joining One Acre Fund, he was able to harvest 12 bags per half acre during the 2012 "long rains" season! He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and buy iron sheets. John’s group members will each receive enough farming inputs to plant on half an acre of land during the 2013 "long rains" season. In total they will receive enough farming inputs for five acres of maize and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Mwangaza Group

texts.en:
Herman is a member of Mwangaza Group in Kakamega District. He is pictured with ten One Acre Fund farmers – seven women and three men. Herman is standing on the right with his hand raised. He is receiving an input loan for a ½ acre of maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Herman first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2012 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Herman joined One Acre Fund in order to access the best input prices and gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer.

Herman described his harvest as good last year as a One Acre Fund farmer and hopes for another good year in the 2013 Long Rains season. He hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send his children to school and repair his home. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Herman’s group members will take input loans of a ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on five acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Lucil

texts.en: Lucil is a 34-year-old married woman and a mother of three young children. She has had a vegetable-growing business for more than 15 years. Her husband also works as a farmer. Lucil is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides. With this, she will be able to improve her farm and eventually her harvest. In the future, Lucil hopes to make her business successful and profitable. Moreover, she wants to save money for the education of her children.

loans.use: To buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es: Nicolás, es un humilde campesino de 57 años de edad, analfabeto pero muy trabajador y activo padre de familia de 5 hijos todos mayores de edad. Él se dedica a sembrar maíz, frijoles y trigo también en la crianza de ganado y cerdos. El comenzó a trabajar a los 10 años de edad junto con su familia al independizarse siguió trabajando en el campo y crio a sus hijos enseñándoles a trabajar la tierra. El junto con su hijo mayor siembran y vende su producto en la misma comunidad cuando no están sembrando se dedican a la venta de cerdos y ganado. El solicito el crédito para comprar alambre, pago de mano de obra para limpieza de terreno. De esta manera prepararse para el nuevo ciclo de siembra que esta próxima a comenzar. Uno de sus planes próximos es cancelar el crédito y comprar 2 manzanas de tierra.
texts.en: Nicolás is a humble 57-year-old farmer. He is illiterate but is a very hard worker and an active father of five children, all of whom are grown up. Nicolás makes a living growing corn, beans and wheat, and raising cattle and pigs. He started working when he was 10 years old with his family so he could become independent, and he continued working in the field and raised his children to teach them how to work off the land. He and his eldest son plant and sell their goods in their community, and when they aren't planting they sell cattle and pigs. Nicolás is requesting the loan to purchase barbed wire and to pay for labor to clean his land. In this way he can prepare for another planting cycle that will soon commence. Among his plans for the future are to pay off the loan and buy two acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase barbed wire and to pay for labor to clean his lands.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more goats to sell.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
This is Maricel. She previously accessed a 40,000 PHP loan that she used to buy additional clothing for children, men, and women. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan to buy additional children's, men's, and women's clothing. The more items displayed at the store, the better. Having more items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profit from her business will definitely help her to provide for her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Maricel dreams that her children will finish their studies, and she hopes to expand her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional merchandise like children's, men's, and women's clothing

loans.name: Jaki

texts.es:
Jaki de 18 años es una joven que a su corta edad y sin responsabilidades familiares de por medio ha logrado consolidarse de manera independiente.Tiene una vivienda de adobe que le fue cedido por sus padres.
Al culminar sus estudios secundarios hallo un déficit económico para poder desempeñar estudios superiores fuera de su localidad, es cuando por idea de su madre optó por dedicarse a la venta de prendas de vestir .
Es un negocio muy interactivo que le permite conocer muchas amistades y a su vez crecer como persona, no obstante la temporada de lluvias es un gran inconveniente para desempeñar su trabajo con fluidez por los alrededores de su localidad.
Preferentemente los fines de semana expende prendas de vestir como pantalones y polos para damas que selecciona personalmente.
Es el segundo lote de prendas que comercializa en esta ocasión , para el cual desea contar con el apoyo de su entidad financiera para incrementar la cantidad de mercadería.
Desea trabajar de manera firme y con la motivación que la caracteriza para a iniciar sus estudios superiores en la carrera de administración de empresas el cual asegura que es el sueño que la motiva desde niña.
Este es su primer crédito con MFP, se siente muy contenta y a la vez agradecida por la oportunidad brindada esperando cumplir firmemente con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Requiere contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de polos, pantalones y camisas que piensa expender en los próximos días.
texts.en: Jaki is an 18-year-old young woman without familial responsibilities who has gone out on her own. She has an adobe home that her parents gave her. After finishing high school she couldn't afford to attend college outside of town, and that's when her mother gave her the idea to make a living selling clothes. It is a very interactive business, which allows Jaki to meet a lot of friends and at the same time grow as a person, though the rainy season is a huge inconvenience for carrying out her work around town. She prefers to go out on weekends with clothes like pants and blouses that she picks out personally. She's on her second batch of clothes to sell, and she plans to use your support to increase her merchandise. She wants to have steady work, with the goal to go to college for a business administration degree and fulfill a dream she has had since she was a little girl. This is her first loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she feels very content and at the same time grateful for the opportunity you are providing. She hopes to make her payments on time. She is requesting the loan to purchase blouses, pants and shirts to sell in the coming days.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, pants and shirts.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia de 47 años, casada con Patricio también de 47 años, actualmente vive en una casa construida a base de adobe.Tuvo una gran trayectoria en el rubro agrícola desde muy joven, no obstante con el paso de los años admite que las fuerzas y destreza van en decadencia , razon por la cual decidio inciarse en el negocio de la elaboración de prendas de vestir a base de lana.
Lleva  casi medio año de trabajo y su talento para los tejidos le ha permitido convertir su negocio en una buena fuente de ingreso para su familia.Comenta que al regresar del campo tejía diversas prendas de vestir a manera de distraerse como un pasatiempo sin saber que años después lograría iniciar un negocio de esta naturaleza .Desea seguir con su negocio , para el cual tiene planeado renovar los instrumentos que usa para la elaboración de las distintas prendas a base de lana.
Sus planes a futuro apuntan en abrir una tienda dedicada a la venta de prendas de vestir que ella elabora .Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y esta muy agradecida por la oportunidad que se le brinda para aumentar sus ingresos económicos.En esta primera oportunidad requiere contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de una maquina de coser y lanas de diversas calidades.
texts.en:
Antonia is 47 years old.  She is married to Patricio and he is also 47 years old.  She actually lives in a house constructed with adobe.  She had a great career in farming from her youth, however with the passing years she admits that her strength and ability are in decline.  This is the reason why she decided to start a business making garments with yarn.

With nearly half a year of work, her talent for knitting has allowed her to turn her business into a good source of income for her family.  She comments that when she returned from the field she would knit different garments as a way to entertain herself as a hobby without knowing that years later she would manage to start a business of this nature.  She desires to continue with her business, which is why she plans to update the tools that she uses for the making the different knit garments.

Her future plans point to opening a store dedicated to the sale of garments that she makes. This is her first loan with MFP, and she is grateful for the opportunity that it gives her to increase her income economically. In this first opportunity she is required to have 1,000 Nuevos Soles in order to buy a new sewing machine and yarn of diverse quality.

loans.use: to buy a sewing maching and yarn of diverse quality.

loans.name: Andimi Group

texts.en:
Andimi is a group of 13 farmers in Kakamega South District represented by Middy. The group has eleven women and two men. Middy is on the right of the photo with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of maize, millet and sorghum. Middy joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2011 and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Middy joined One Acre Fund so that she could grow enough food for her family and gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Middy was only able to harvest one bag of maize per 3/4 acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, she was able to harvest five bags per 3/4 acre! She plans on using future profits from the harvest to send her children to school and buy a cow.

Middy’s group members will each receive input loans for ½ acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total, they will receive inputs for 6 1/2 acres of maize, millet and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en: Adelaida has been raising hogs for more than 20 years now. This has been the source of her income. Adelaida is asking for a loan to buy feed and food supplements for the pigs. With this, she will be able to improve her hog-raising business; thus, augmenting her income and profit. In the future, Adelaida hopes to make her business grow to be sustainable. Moreover, she wants to save money to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy feed and food supplements for the pigs

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en: Chantal is 28 years old.  She sells various items in her store.  With this loan, she wants to buy more electrical items to sell.  With the profits she wants to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: to buy electrical items for her store.

loans.name: Tawirirana Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe!  This is 54-year-old Lucia from Mutare.  She is widowed with five children, two attending school.  She also cares for one dependent.  Lucia runs a retail business selling dried foods.  The business has been in operation for 8 years.  She says the main challenge is the lack of working capital.  Lucia has requested a loan of $1,200 to buy more dried foods for resale.  She says the extra income will allow her to add some assets and build a recently acquired residential stand.  In the future Lucia plans to operate at a larger scale.

loans.use: to buy dried foods for resale.

loans.name: Nimpha

texts.en:
Nimpha is 57 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Nimpha has a dress-making business in the Philippines. Nimpha requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her dress-making business like thread, cloth, buttons, etc. 

Nimpha has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, Nimpha would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy materials for her dress-making business like thread, cloth, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en:
Mlongo is married and works hard to support two children by buying and selling dried fish at the market.  She requested 25,000 KES through Yehu Microfinance Trust in order to purchase dried fish.  Mlongo has been in this business for the past 10 years.

In the future, Mlongo would like to send her kids to school and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish.

loans.name: Lourlyn

texts.en: Lourlyn is 43 years old and married with two children, one currently in school.  Lourlyn works very hard to provide for them by running a general store in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 5 years.  She requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell, such as shampoo, milk, sugar, oil and other groceries.  In the future Lourlyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items for her general store (shampoo, milk, sugar, oil, etc.).

loans.name: Mars

texts.en:
Mars is a 47-year-old woman and is married to David, 48. They are blessed with four children: Makris (25) and James (23), both are working; Albert (18), graduated from senior high school; and Nando (16), in the 2nd grade of vocational high school. 

Mars has been running a food stall business at one of school area for almost a year. She sells yellow rice with side dishes, such as fried egg, fried soybean, and fried noodles. She also sells instant noodles and kinds of cakes.  

Mars plans to improve her business by selling cold drink as demanded by students at the school. Unfortunately, she does not have capital to do so. Therefore, she requested a loan from TLM, amounting to 3,000,000 IDR. The loan will be spent on cold drinks, a blender for juice, and a cool box.

loans.use: to be spend on cold drinks, blender for juice and a cool box.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en: Alaa is 24 years old and single. She is still working as a secretary in one of the university's departments. Her previous loan has helped her and her family in paying the semester fees with less daily financial stress. For that Alaa is applying for another educational loan to pay for her next semester fees, and she hopes that after getting a Bachelor's degree she can register in a higher degree program.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees

loans.name: Ikumu Mwangaza Group

texts.en:
Ikumu Mwangaza Group is located in Kakamega South District. It is a group of nine women and six men led by Wenslaus pictured on the right with his hand raised. He is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Wenslaus first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2011 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Wenslaus joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and grow enough food for the family.

Wenslaus described his harvest as good last year, but he believes he can have an even better one this year. He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and save for the future. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Wenslaus’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 7½ acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Meu

texts.en:
Meu, 47 years of age, is a married woman and a mother of three children. She is currently residing in small village of Reussey Keo district, an area of Phnom Penh. She has a position in a local market as a fish vendor. In parallel, Meu husband sells crushed ice with syrup to especially to adults or young children in the street. Together, this couple is fortunate to generate approximately $7 USD each day to provide for the needs of their family. They have been doing this more than five years.

To help her employed children who are currently facing transportation difficulty, she would like to obtain a loan amounting to $1,200 USD to purchase a motorcycle for supporting her children in their traveling needs. Also, she will use the remaining funds to purchase a sugar cane juice machine for her husband in order to improve his business pursuits. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted, so that she will further improve her family-owned businesses and her living status.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for supporting her children in their transportation needs.

loans.name: Ikhonye Group

texts.en:
Jaffery’s group has 14 farmers and is located in Kakamega South District. Jaffery is pictured on the right of Ikhonye Group with his hand raised. Jaffery is pictured amongst the six men and eight women of his group. He will receive input loans allowing him to plant ½ an acre with sorghum, millet and maize. Jaffery joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Jaffery joined One Acre Fund so that he could gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and grow enough food for the family.

Jaffery described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year. He plans on using future profits from the harvest to repair his home and save for the future. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Jaffery’s group will receive 7 acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Rafaq Hussain

texts.en: Mr. Rafaq Hussain is 33 years old and a very hardworking person. He lives in Lahore, Pakistan with his family. He is a responsible father of two children. Since 2002, Rafaq Hussain has been running a butcher shop in the main market which is the only source of income for the family. He has requested for a loan amount of 100,000 PKR in order to purchase product for the butcher shop. He will increase his business if he gets a good amount of profit in the future. He is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase cows in order to sell meat.

loans.name: Elnur

texts.en:
Elnur is a 41-year-old man, married with two children. He sells seasonal fruits and vegetables such as pears, oranges, apples, pomegranates, bananas, onions, potatoes and cabbage. Elnur has ten years of experience in this field and gained necessary skills and knowledge required for his business. 

Fruits are very popular among Azerbaijan people and in high demand during the year.  People like to eat fresh fruit and this is one of the main desserts for guests. His shop located in the bazaar and people always pass his shop and come to buy some fresh fruits. His monthly income from this business is 300 AZN. Elnur's wife helps him to sell fruits.

Elnur wants to expand his business. He does not have enough products to cover the high demand. He would like to purchase more fruits and vegetables and increase his turnover as well as improve the life of his family. For this purpose he has applied for a loan of 1000 AZN.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Shakeel Ahmed

texts.en:
Shakeel Ahmed is a 37-year-old independent person. He lives in Lahore, Pakistan with his family. He is a father of two, both of whom are students. He is a supplier of construction materials which is a very successful business. He purchases materials from the factory and sells them in the market. This business is the only source of income for his family. Therefore he is interested in increasing his business. 

Shakeel Ahmed has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a variety of construction materials such as cement, bricks and concrete to sell. 

He dreams of providing his children with a quality education. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of construction materials such as cement, bricks and concrete to sell.

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en:
Valentine is from Kisauni, Mombasa. She is married and a mother of four children. Valentine is the owner of a store where she's been working for four years. She says that she's making headway with the business because she's attracted a good number of customers due to the fact that she always has a very well-stocked store. She is a very enthusiastic person who wants to keep growing and investing in her business so that she can help with the household expenses and continue to improve her business over time.

Valentine is requesting a loan to invest in drinks, dairy products, bread, vegetables, and other products. This way, she can continue to provide her customers with a good variety of products and also attract new customers.

loans.use: to invest in drinks, dairy products, bread, vegetables, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Jeyran

texts.en:
Jeyran is a 52-year-old woman and is married with two sons. She is a market vendor and sells women's clothes in the bazaar. She has more than 10 years of experience in this field. She knows the taste of local ladies and doing her best to fulfill their needs. Her monthly income is 220 Azerbaijanian Manat (AZN), and she would like to increase it.
 
She was on pension when she started her business. Low financial income and the joblessness of her husband pushed her to start her own business which she is now proud of!

Jeyran applied for 1200 AZN to purchase seasonal clothes and cover customers' demand. This will be her first loan, and Jeyran promises to pay on time.

loans.use: to buy clothes for the upcoming Spring season

loans.name: Cinthia Paola

texts.es:
Cinthia es una mujer de 26 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con su esposo y su pequeño hijo de 2 años, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta que junto con el apoyo de su esposo dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Cinthia pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Educación, en sus ratos libres le gusta dedicar un poco de tiempo a la lectura y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia con mucho empeño y dedicación, Cinthia trabaja como maestra de educación primaria en un centro educativo de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 11 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien su paciencia y buen trato a sus alumnos.
Cinthia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos de estudios de su pequeño, ya que pronto iniciará sus estudios iniciales y tiene que matricularlo y comprar sus útiles, de esta manera Cinthia seguirá trabajando y en poco tiempo desea estudiar un diplomado para actualizar sus conocimientos, así pues Cinthia espera lograr su gran sueño de terminar la construcción de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Cinthia, 26, lives in the city of Ica with her husband and her two year old son, both of whom she loves and who are her principal reason for living. She is very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic. Together with the support of her spouse, she works to get her family ahead. Thanks to her hard work and the support of her parents, Cinthia was able to get a degree in Education. In her free time she likes to read a little bit and sometimes cooks Carapulcra con Sopa Seca [a pork and potato stew with noodles] to share with her family.

By her own initiative, and with a lot of dedication and tenacity, Cinthia works as a primary school teacher at a school in her city. She starts every day early in the morning and can work for up to 11 hours. She is happy doing her work and believes that her patience and good treatment of her students make it go well.

Cinthia is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help she will be able to cover the cost of her young son's education, who will soon start school. She has to pay his enrollment fees and buy his supplies. This way Cinthia can keep working. Soon she would like to do a certification course to update her knowledge. Cinthia hopes to achieve her greatest dream of finishing construction on their home.

loans.use: to cover her son's school expenses.

loans.name: Rukiya

texts.en:
Rukiya has been married for several years. She and her husband have four young children who are still attending primary school, and the couple work hard for their children to get ahead in life.

Rukiya runs her own water distribution firm, which she was able to buy as a result of a lot of hard work. It is thanks to the work she carries out that they can give their children an education, and buy all necessities for the home.

Rukiya has proven herself to be a very responsible and honest person in terms of her commitments. She comments that it is thanks to her service that her customers have access to treated water. Rukiya is seeking this loan to buy a large water tank to store enough water to distribute. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is being given as it will be of great use to her.

loans.use: to buy a large water tank to store enough water to distribute.

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en:
Alvard is an accountant. For many years she worked in many enterprises, but after becoming jobless she launched her own business. She started reselling foodstuffs and household goods, and she has been doing this for more than five years. She obtains the merchandise for trading from suppliers and resells them in separate location, in her house. Alvard has many clients from Vanadzor and her business is going well. 

Alvard is 54 years old and lives in Vanadzor City with her husband and son. She has also a daughter who is married and lives separately from her parents. Her son is a promising student at State Regional College of Lori. Alvard pays for her son's tuition and meets her family's needs with the profit from her trading. 

Alvard needs loan of 250,000 Armenian drams to increase her shop's inventory. Thus Kiva lenders not only can help Alvard to enlarge business, but also can help a number of citizens of Vanadzor city, who don't have the opportunity to go to big supermarkets to buy necessary goods. Shopping at Alvard's shop is very accessible and easy for them.

loans.use: to increase the number of her shop's food and household goods.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
This is Vivian, 42, a resident of Cabrera, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Anastacio, a vendor. She, with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Vivian maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, and other products through popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and others. A customer's order is paid for in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealers' prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are depending on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 5000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Vivian hopes that her business will continue to be successful and dreams of having a new house. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and products such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Boota

texts.en:
Mr. Boota is a very hardworking and independent person. Since 1997 he has been running a business of milk supply in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is 38 years old and the father of 5 children. All of his children are students and his wife is a housewife. 

Mr. Boota sells his milk in the market and delivers it door to door as well. His clients like his fresh and pure milk very much. This business is the only source of income for his family; therefore he is interested in further growing his business. By doing this he will be able to put aside some savings for his family's future. 

Mr. Boota has requested a loan amount of 120,000 PKR from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase buffalo for his business. By purchasing buffalo he will be able to get more milk to sell. This will help him increase his net income.  He is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for his family and business.

He is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase buffalo so he can sell milk.

loans.name: Lia

texts.en:
Lia is from the village Tsilkani, East Georgia. She is 27 years old and married and lives with her family, which consists of her husband and two infant children. Lia’s husband works as a security guard and gets a small monthly salary. In addition, he owns a tractor and services local farmers during tilling season, for which he receives a fee. 

Lia has requested credit for cultivating agricultural land. She will cover the costs related to purchasing fuel for the tractor. The family will sow maize on the land and after proper seasonal work, Lia can count on a good harvest next year. They will sell the harvest for a convenient price, and this income will be used for the family's daily needs.

loans.use: to cultivate land for agricultural goods.

loans.name: Wakulima Group

texts.en:
Seen here among his Wakulima Group members, David is on the right with his hand raised. The seventeen members of his group, eleven women and six men, are farmers in Kakamega South District. For the 2013 Long Rains planting season, David’s group members will each receive loans to support planting one-half acre of land. This works out to a group loan sustaining eight and a half acres of land.

David joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains of 2012 so that he could grow enough food for his family and use his increase in profits to send his children to school. He described his harvest last year as a good one. He is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 planting season program. With his enrollment he will receive on credit enough seed and fertilizer to plant one-half acre of maize, millet and sorghum.

David hopes for another good year in the 2013 Long Rains season. He hopes that the profits he earns during this time can be used to continue sending his children to school and buy a cow.

loans.use: to buy hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

Rizalina has been in this business for 4 years and earns additional income from her general store.

Rizalina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Inua Group

texts.en:
Crescentia is a member of Inua Group in Kakamega South District in Kenya. She is pictured with 10 One Acre Fund farmers: 8 women and 2 men. Crescentia is standing on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for ½ an acre of maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Crescentia first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2010 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Crescentia joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and to access the best input prices.

Crescentia reports that before One Acre Fund, she was able to grow about 5 bags of maize per ½ acre, but with her One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, she harvested 10 bags per 1/2 acre. She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to invest in cows and save for the future. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Crescentia’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a widow with eight children. She lives in her own house in Kisauni with her children. She says she makes her living distributing water to her neighbours and passersby. She's been doing this for more than ten years and has quite a few customers because she does good work.

Fatuma's services are the best in town as evidenced by the courtesy she affords her customers which is highly praised by all. She says she is seeking help from Yehu Microfinance Trust because she wants to keep growing. She's requesting a loan to repair her water tank because she has only one and she needs to continue serving the large number of customers she has every day.

loans.use: to repair her water tank.

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en:
Arnold is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bicycle repair business in Mombasa. 

He is borrowing 30,000 KES through Yehu Microfinance Trust to buy soldering equipment for his business.

Arnold successfully paid back his previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build his business.

Yehu Microfinance Trust is relisting Arnold's business profile again in support of his efforts to secure the future of his business.

loans.use: to buy soldering equipment for his business.

loans.name: Shavarsh

texts.en:
Shavarsh has already been a successful businessman for two years. He has run his own computer accessories business in a rented shop located near his house in Vanadzor city. He buys the necessary merchandise from Yerevan wholesale markets and transports them to Vanadzor with his car once a month. 

Shavarsh also does computer repairs, software, downloading, and other services by order in his shop.
   
Shavarsh graduated from State Engineering University of Armenia as a programmer. He is 24 years old and lives with his parents and younger brother in Vanadzor city. 

His brother studies at State Engineering University and decided he will help Shavarsh in his business after graduation. 

Shavarsh requests a Kiva loan of 500,000 Armenian drams to buy computer accessories, discs, monitors, etc. for reselling, which will help him to increase his profit from trading.

loans.use: to buy computer accessories, discs, monitors, etc. for reselling

loans.name: Kasenyi United Group

texts.en:
Kabira, age 48, requests a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from Kasenyi United Group.

Widowed with 4 children, none of whom are at school, she engages in the business of locally brewing beer (waragi). She works every day throughout the week. She is also a fish monger who buys fish from fishermen and sells to the people neighboring the lake, as well as others.

She started the business in 2002. It is located in Kasenyi, a landing site in Kasese western Uganda. She was troubled with lack of capital and her search for sources of finance to expand her business landed her in a group funded by Ugafode and she has never looked back since.

She will use the money to buy more locally brewed beers for selling. Her clients are people around the lake shores of Kasenyi, especially the fish mongers. She hopes to be a prosperous business lady in the future. She faces the challenges of price fluctuations, and sometimes some people take on credit and fail to pay. She is an honest and hardworking person.

In the above photo, Kabira is the lady in the front row with a black top.

loans.use: to buy locally brewed beer to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim says that thanks to the previous loan that he received from Kiva, he was able to provide better products to his customers, and he was able to grow sufficiently. He was very grateful for this support.

Today, he is once again interested in asking for further assistance. He wants to invest again in the grocery store to be able to stock it with more products and a variety of supplies such as beverages, dairy products, vegetables and other supplies. He is very grateful for the new opportunity that he's receiving since it will a great help to him.

loans.use: to stock more products and a variety of supplies such as beverages, dairy products, vegetables and other supplies.

loans.name: Rizwan Ahmed

texts.en:
Mr. Rizwan Ahmed has been running a small linens shop in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He sells bedsheets, blankets and pillows in his shop. This shop is the only source of income for the family. He is a very hard working person and tries his best to fulfill the needs of his family. 

Presently he is interested in growing his business by purchasing a variety of bedsheets, pillows and blankets to sell. Therefore, he has requested a loan amount of 130,000 PKR (Pakistan rupees) from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. He is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for his business and his family's future as well. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of bedsheets, pillows, blankets, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Justo

texts.es:
Justo es un hombre de 53 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus 8 hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, lamentablemente hace poco tiempo Justo sufrió la pérdida de su amada esposa, desde entonces él es el pilar que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por mantener unidad a su familia, Justo es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, lastimosamente no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Civil, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Pollo Broaster para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Justo trabaja en el rubro de construcción, el brinda sus servicios como maestro de obras y trabaja diariamente un aproximado de 8 horas, él se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por los buenos acabados de sus trabajos.
Justo se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una computadora, la cual servirá de mucho para que sus hijos menores puedan tener una herramienta adecuada para sus estudios, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propia empresa y con ello espera sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Justo, 53, lives in the city of Ica with his 8 children, who he loves and who are his main reason for living. Unfortunately, some time ago Justo lost his beloved wife, and since then he is the pillar who works to keep his family together. Justo is very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic. He was not able to study a professional career - he would have chosen Civil Engineering - but he would have very much liked to have done so. In his free time he likes to listen to music and sometimes cooks a delicious roasted chicken to share with his family.

By his own initiative, and with a lot of tenacity and dedication, Justo works in the field of construction. He is a master builder and works about 8 hours a day. He is happy doing his work and thinks that it goes well because of his good finished products.

Justo is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help he will be able to buy a computer which will help his younger children as a tool for their studies. He will continue working hard to achieve his greatest dream of having his own business, and with that he hopes to be able to get his family ahead.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Mot-Praise

texts.en:
Mot-Praise lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado county. She is 33 years old, a high school graduate, and she is married with two children, ages 2 and 8, who are in school and live at home. For the past year, she has been operating a shop in her community where she sells cold water, rice, pepper, soap, vita and other items. She received a little amount from her husband to start this business, and she learned this way of trading from her mother. She likes her business because she makes more profit.

She is requesting a loan to purchase cold water, rice, pepper, soap, vita and other items to expand her business. Her plan is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase cold water, rice, pepper, soap, vita and other items to expand her business.

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en: Laurence is 36 years old. She is married with two children. The oldest is five and the youngest is two month. Her husband is her partner in business. She has been in business for five years. She wants a loan to buy more hair products for her business.  With the profit she will put it towards her savings account.

loans.use: to buy more hair products for use in the salon

loans.name: Ilala Farmers Group

texts.en:
Ilala Farmers Group is located in Kakamega South District. It is a group of nine women and one man led by Christine pictured on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for ½ an acre of maize, millet and sorghum cultivation. Christine joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2009, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Christine joined One Acre Fund so that she could grow enough food for the family and use the increased profits to send her children to school. 

Christine described her harvest as poor last year, but believes she can have a better one this year. She plans on using future profits from the harvest to send her children to school and invest in cows. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Christine’s group will receive 5 acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson has a family of five people made up of his wife and four children. He has two children who are in school.

In 2008, Jackson started a business of produce trade (maize, beans, millet) as a way of generating income to look after the family. The business is still operating up to date.

He wants a loan of 2,000,000 (two million shillings only) to buy more maize and beans for trade, since the season is now on and he has limited capital in the business at the moment. Jackson is always challenged by the changing weather, which affects production, as well as the price fluctuation on the market. 

His dream is to acquire enough land and invest in commercial farming. Jackson is hardworking and would like the lender to extend agricultural funding so that he can have his dream of commercial farming fulfilled.

loans.use: To buy maize and beans for trade.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a 36-year-old woman who lives in West Point, known as one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado county, with her four children. She has not attended school and is married. Her children are attending school. For the past six years she has been selling bananas and oranges from a table in the local market. Sometimes business is slow, but most of the time she realizes profit and she uses it to sustain her family. 

Evelyn is requesting a loan to purchase more bananas and oranges to expand her sales. She hopes to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas and oranges to expand her sales.

loans.name: Dilshad Anwar

texts.en:
Mr. Dilshad Anwar has been running a shoes shop in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is a 33-year-old independent and honest person. He is a father of four children. 

Presently, Mr. Dilshad Anwar has requested a loan for the amount of 120,000 PKR from Kiva's partner BRAC Paksitan. He needs the financing to purchase a variety of shoes to sell. This will help him to offer more variety to his clients and to increase his net income as well. He is hoping to get a good profit from the loan amount. He dreams of the bright future of his children. 

He is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of shoes to sell.

loans.name: Gladys Belen

texts.es:
Gladys es una mujer de 31 años, vive en la ciudad de Imperial con su pequeño hijo, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su pequeño, ya que ella es padre y madre para él; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de su familia, Gladys pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Farmacia, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar vóley y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Cau Cau para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Gladys trabaja en una farmacia de su ciudad, adicionalmente tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de tortas, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buena sazón y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Gladys se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de un horno pequeño, el cual le servirá de mucho para poder preparar mejor sus tortas y queques, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder  estudiar la carrera profesional de Medicina Humana y especializarse en ella.
texts.en:
Thirty-one year old Gladys lives in the city of Imperial with her young son, whom she loves and who is her main reason for living.  Gladys is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person, who puts all her strength into helping her son prosper.  She must be both mother and father to him.  Thanks to the strength and support of her family, Gladys was able to study pharmacy and in her spare time she enjoys playing volleyball.  On occasion she prepares a delicious "caucau" (a type of stew) to share with the family.

With her own initiative and with determination and dedication, Gladys works in a pharmacy in the city.  Additionally she has a small business selling cakes.  She works every day, from early in the morning, for around ten hours.  She likes her work and thinks it is going well because of the flavours in the cakes and because of the friendly service she provides to her customers.

Gladys is very grateful to the Kiva lenders as thanks to their help she will be able to buy a small oven.  She will use this to prepare better cakes and so she can continue to work and put in a lot of effort to achieve her dream of studying and specialising in medicine.

loans.use: to buy an oven.

loans.name: Superacion Group

texts.es:
La señora Paula esta casada, tiene 62 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 9 hijos y 2 de ellos estudian, se dedica a la artesanía a la elaboración de jarros, ollas, comales, sartenes, etc; todas estas de barro, inicio este negocio siendo ayudante y operaria con otra señora, hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la agricultura.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de colorantes, que le ayudara a mejorar su producción de platos, vasos, ollas y subales de barro, espera en el futuro contar  con varios trabajadores y puntos de ventas. Las demás integrantes se dedica a la confección de tejido, oficios domésticos, crianza de animales, y a la artesanía.
texts.en:
Mrs. Paula, 62, is married. She has nine children, two of them are studying; she could not study herself. Paula is an artisan: she makes jars, pots, “comales” [a flat griddle to cook food], pans, etc. in clay. She started this business ten years ago while she worked as an assistant with another woman. Her husband supports her with his job in agriculture.

Paula started a group and is requesting a loan to buy dyes, needed to improve the production process of plates, vases, pots and clay "subales" [a utensil used for steaming]. She hopes to have several employees in the future and several establishments. The remaining members weave clothes, raise livestock, or are housekeepers or artisans.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make handicrafts.

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Activas está en su ciclo número 15 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde unas 5 se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, pero se esfuerzan para poder tener mejores ingresos y así ayudar a sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Antoliana, o también conocida como doña Anto, quien en su última encuesta mostro un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, que según nuestros indicadores estaría en un nivel intermedio. Entre el trabajo que ella hace se destaca la venta de  remedios naturales y no solo es la venta si no también los consejos de doña Anto para con sus clientes lo que la ayuda en su negocio.
Doña Anto Solicita de este crédito para la compra de sus hierbas medicinales que no deben faltar, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This group, "Mujeres Activas" (Active Women, in English) is on its 15th loan cycle in the women's committee program.  All of the members work and help each to other move forward.  They have all done surveys on eliminating poverty and five members of the group live below the poverty line.  However, they all put in an effort to have a better income and so help their families.

One of the group members is Antoliana, also known as Anto.  At the last survey, Anto was living in "level two" poverty, which our indicators suggest is an intermediate level.  A big part of her work is selling natural remedies but Anto says it is not just the sales of products that matter but the advice that she offers to her customers that help the business.

Anto is applying for this loan to buy medicinal herbs, which she must not run out of.  This will help her to strengthen her business and so improve her imcome.

loans.use: to buy natural herbs to sell.

loans.name: Buena Vista 2 Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de la cuidad de Encarnación surgió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la fundación,  trabajan con la desde el año 2012,  se encuentran  en el 3er. ciclo,  y gracias al trabajo que todas hacen también ya tienen un ahorro que las ayuda a seguir trabajando y tener así un soporte en caso de necesidad.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Gladys, ella tiene su Almacén bien surtido en su casa, está casada con el Sr. Nelson que es empleado de una empresa, tienen 1 hijo, por quien ambos se esfuerzan por salir adelante e ir mejorando sus vidas.
Ella solicita de este crédito para la compra de bebidas, lácteos, verduras, y demás insumos para poder seguir trabajando y así ayudar a su familia a tener un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
This group, from the city of Encarnación, came about when one member contacted the foundation.  The group has now been working since 2012 and it is on its third loan cycle.  Thanks to the work that all the members do they also now have savings which help them to continue working and to have support if necessary.

One of the group's members is Gladys.  She has a well-stocked grocery store running out of her house.  She is married to Nelson, who is employed at a business.  They have one child, for whom both parents work hard to prosper and to make their lives better.

Gladys is applying for a loan to buy drinks, dairy products, vegetable and other supplies in order to continue working and so help her family to have a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy drinks, dairy products, vegetables and other supplies.

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es:
Rosa, 55 años de edad, habitante de la ciudad de Granada, madre de 3 hijos de 29, 27 y 25 años de edad de los cuales solo le ayuda a la menor que aún está estudiando su último año de la universidad, los otros 2 viven independientes. 
Desde muy joven inicio a trabajar en el comercio pues su madre les enseño a ganarse la vida desde niña, fue creciendo y aprendiendo a ser una mujer independiente, generar recursos por sí misma. Al casarse su esposo le exigió que dejara de trabajar para dedicarse a las labores del hogar, pero ella decidió continuar adelante y paso en pequeño negocio venta de refrescos naturales. Sufrió una separación, pero continuo levantando poco a poco su negocio el cual le sirvió para apoyar a sus hijos en los estudios. Actualmente además de vender refrescos y frijoles cosidos alquila parte de su casa para conseguir otro tipo de ingresos. 
Está necesitando el financiamiento para comprar bolsas plásticas, pajillas, frutas, arroz, azúcar, frijoles. Pues necesita comprar más materia prima para producir y vender mayor cantidad de refrescos, tiene como planes futuros poner un puesto de hamburguesas para diversificar su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa, 55 years old, is a resident of the city of Granada. She is a mother of three children ages 29, 27 and 25, of which she only supports the youngest child who is still studying his last year of college. The other two children live independently.

From a very young age, she started working in trade as her mother taught her to how to make a living while she was a girl.  As she was growing up, she was learning to be an independent woman and to provide for herself. Upon getting married, her husband demanded that she stop working and dedicate herself to the housework but she decided to go ahead and started a small business selling natural soft drinks.  She suffered through her marriage separation but she continued slowly growing her business, which served to support her children in their studies.  

Currently besides selling refreshments and cooked beans, she rents part of her house to get additional income. She needs the loan funding to purchase plastic bags, drinking straws, fruit, rice, sugar, beans. She also needs to buy more raw materials in order to produce and sell a larger volume of drinks.  In the future, she has plans to put up a hamburger stand to diversify her business.

loans.use: to buy plastic bags, drinkng straws, fruit, rice, sugar, beans

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Luchadoras está en su ciclo número 15, ellas estan haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 5 integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, resultado que ha salido del análisis de sus encuestas, estas mujeres en especial están viendo en el comité una gran ayuda para ellas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Ursulina, quien en su última encuesta mostro un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, es decir intermedio. A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza, pero igualmente está consciente que su trabajo de modista la está ayudando mucho a salir adelante y también con ello ayuda a su familia.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de mas telas, hilos, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos. Ella y su grupo agradecen por la oportunidad que están recibiendo, ya que les será de mucha ayuda, no solo a ella, sino también a sus familias.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres Luchadoras" is in its 15 loan cycle.  Upon taking the poverty elimination survey, five members were found to be below the poverty line and these women, in particular, are finding the communal bank to be of great help to them.

One of the members of the group is Ursulina, who showed a a level 2 (intermediate) poverty level on her last survey.  With support she has been able to get ahead and also help her family.

Ursulina is requesting a loan to buy fabric and thread so she can concrete her business plan and improve her income.  She and the other members of the group are grateful for this opportunity which is very helpful to them and their families.

loans.use: To buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es:
Florinda tiene 36 años y con ella su compañero de vida Raúl de 45 años, tiene el orgullo de ser madre de 3 pequeños Zayra de 16 años, Kendy de 13 años y Luis de 5. Comparte sus vivencias familiares en una vivienda construida a base de Adobe que construyo con apoyo de su familia. Inicialmente desempeñaba junto a su esposo actividades agrícolas como el mantenimiento de cacao orgánico en unas parcelas que heredo de sus padres. Posteriormente motivada por la buena demanda de prendas de vestir al caceo que vio en su localidad optó por incursionar en el negocio iniciándose con una docena polos y pantalones.
Lleva casi 3 años en el negocio y con paso del tiempo ha logrado convertir este negocio como un buen componente para el crecimiento de su economía familiar paralelo a la producción cacaotera que desempeña Raúl. No obstante admite que recorrer diversas zonas de la su localidad la agotan considerablemente haciendo de este un trabajo finalmente reconfortante.
Sin embargo siente tener vocación para dicha actividad puesto que gracias a tratar con diversas personas ha logrado entablar muchas amistades así como clientes constantes.
A modo de incrementar sus ingresos planea realizar la compra de mercadería al por mayor para en los próximos fines de semana recorrer diversos puntos de su localidad.
Sus planes a futuro apuntan justamente en aperturar un negocio del rubro y ubicarlo en una tienda en ambiente que da para la calle en su domicilio. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, agradecida por la oportunidad se muestra muy contante y a la vez comprometida con el pago puntual del mismo.
En esta primera ocasión requiere contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de mercadería consistente en polos manga larga, pantalones semi pitillo y medias.
texts.en:
Florinda is 36 years old. Together with her life partner, Raul, age 45, she is proud to have three children: 16 year-old Zayra, 13 year-old Kendy and 5 year-old Luis. They share their family experiences in an adobe home constructed with the support of her family. She initially worked together with her husband in agricultural work such as the production of organic cacao on some plots of land which she inherited from her family. Later, motivated by the high demand of clothing which she saw in her district, she decided to try her hand at the business, beginning with a dozen shirts and pants.

She has been in the business for almost three years now. With time she has succeeded in making this business an important source of income for her family, in conjunction with the cacao production carried out by Raul. Although she admits that travelling around the different zones of her district tires her out considerably, this work is, in the end, relaxing.

Nevertheless, she feels that this work is her calling: Thanks to her contact with a wide variety of people, she has formed many friendships as well as gained regular customers.

In order to increase her income she plans to buy merchandise in bulk. During subsequent weekends she will travel to the different areas in her district. 

In the future she plans to open a clothing store with a store front that opens onto the street of her home. 

This is her first loan with MFP. She is thankful and pleased to have this opportunity. She is also committed to a punctual repayment. On this first occasion she requires 1,000 nuevo soles to buy the merchandise, including long sleeve shirts, skinny pants and stockings.

loans.use: to buy long sleeve shirts, skinny pants, and stockings.

loans.name: Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
El Comité Santa Rosa actualmente se encuentra en el ciclo 14 del programa de mujeres emprendedoras, son señoras con aspiraciones y deseos de trabajar, habitualmente todas se dedican en la artesania, son comerciantes y macateras (vendedoras ambulantes) con el incentivo  de generar ingresos para una buena calidad de vida, no solo de ellas, sino también de sus familias.
La Sra. Maria es una de las integrantes que mayormente se dedica a trabajar como  empleada doméstica y su actividad principal es el macate, se dedica en la venta de ropas en forma ambulante y muy agradecida y orgullosa por ser parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, mediante eso ella puede exclusivamente dedicarse a su actividad que es sumamente importante para ella y de esa forma ayudar a su familia y sentirse útil, como se puede ver, ella es una persona que lucha por salir adelante y ser la mejor en lo que hace.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de prendas de todo tipo y así seguir con sus ventas y tener de todo para poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Santa Rosa" is in its 14th women entrepreneurs loan cycle.  The members have ambitions and a desire to work, and most of them work in craft-making and as street vendors.  Their incentive is generate an income not only for themselves but also for their families to lead a better lifestyle.

Maria is one of the members of the group.  She is a domestic employee and also sells clothing as a street vendor.  She is very grateful and proud to be a part of the women entrepreneurs group, which allows her to conduct a business that is very important to her when it comes to feeingl useful while helping her family.  She struggles to get ahead and to be the best at what she does.

She is requesting a loan to buy all kinds of clothing to offer to her customers in an effort to increase sales.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Mirta

texts.es:
La Señora Mirta de 37 años de edad está casada desde hace 18 años con el señor Calixto de 52 años de edad; el matrimonio tiene 4 hijos todos varones de 17, 14, 11 y 5 años y todos están cursando sus estudios en primaria y secundaria.
La Sra. Mirta tiene una despensa y carnicería desde hace 1 año, es la continuación del negocio donde sus padres desde hace muchos años tenían funcionando, ahora que ya son viejos decidieron vender todo a su hija que con el capital que le ayudo a tener su esposo y ahora ella está administrando sin problemas con todos los clientes.
Solicita este préstamo para la compra de fideos, harina, aceites, yerba, galleta, mandioca, bebidas , golosinas, zapatillas y carnes que lo comercializará en su negocio,  así ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes y tener la posibilidad de aumentar sus ingresos. Ella agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo., ya que le será muy útil, no solo a ella sino también a toda su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mirta, 37, married Mr. Calixto, 52, eighteen years ago. They have four sons who are 17, 14, 11 and 5 years old that go to primary, middle and high school.

Mrs. Mirta has had a butcher’s/grocery store for a year. She bought it from her parents, who had it for a long time and decided to sell it now that they are old. Her husband helped her gather the money; she runs it now and has a good customer base.

She is requesting a loan to buy noodles, flour, different types of oil, yerba, cookies, cassava, beverages, sweets, shoes and different types of meat to sell in her store. She will be able to offer her clients a wider variety, which will result in a higher income. She appreciates the opportunity she has because it will be useful, not only for her but also for her family.

loans.use: to buy noodles, flour, yerba, cookies, different types of meat and other supplies for her store.

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.es:
El comité Virgen del Rosario opera con la Fundación desde el año 2.007, registran un historial de pago excelente. Este grupo se  encuentra en la ciudad de Paraguarí, está conformado por 16 mujeres que realizan distintas actividades. Deciden formar su grupo y acceder al crédito que la institución les ofrece, más allá de la oportunidad de crédito que se les brinda les motiva el hecho de trabajar en equipo, puesto que todas son conocidas y vecinas. El grupo se encuentra haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza y el 50 porciento está por encima de la pobreza, un 40 se encuentra intermedio y un diez porciento por debajo.
Carmen, la presidenta de este grupo, se dedica a la venta de bebidas y por medio de su trabajo está saliendo adelante y ayuda a su familia por medio de su trabajo. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de bebidas en general, ya que esto le ayudará a seguir creciendo y de esa forma tener un mejor ingreso.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Virgen del Rosario" has been working with the Foundation since 2007 and has an excellent credit record.  The group is located in the city of Paraguarí and is comprised of 16 women who are involved in different business activities.  In addition to setting up their group to be able to access loans from the institution, they are motivated by the team work because they are all acquaintances and neighbors.  The group has taken a poverty elimination survey and 50% of them are above the line, 40% are at the intermediate level and 10% below the line.

Carmen, who is the president of the group, sells liquor and through her work is able to get ahead and help her family.  She is requesting a loan to buy liquor in general, as this will help her to continue to expand and increase her income.

loans.use: To buy liquor to sell.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
Las 13 integrantes cuentan con actividades variadas, cada una de ellas invierten sus créditos para el sustento de sus planes de negocios, son mujeres jefas de familia que quieren ayudar a sus hijos y familiares a salir adelante.
Una de estas mujeres es la Sra. Angelica, quien es modista, ella comenta que se ha hecho de muy buena clientela gracias al buen servicio que da a sus clientes, y eso hace que queden satisfechos y quieran volver junto a ella. Cuenta que está orgullosa de lo que hace, ya que es un oficio digno y decoroso.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, gomas y demás insumos para poder seguir creciendo como microemprendedora.
texts.en:
The 13 members of the group have different business activities, and plan to invest the loan in supporting their respective businesses.  They are all heads of family who want to help their children and families get ahead.

One of the membes is Angelica who is a seamstress.  She says she has a very good clientele because of her good customer service.  That is the reason they are happy and always come back.  She is proud of what she does because her work is decent and dignified.  She is requesting a loan to buy fabric, thread and elastic, as well as other supplies she needs to continue growing as a small business owner.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, elastic, etc.

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Virgen del Rosario está en su ciclo número 7 del programa de comité de mujeres. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde la mayoria de sus integrantes va superando los 50 indicadores de la eliminación de pobreza y se esfuerzan por salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lucila quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel 3, en su mayoría y ha podido mejorar notablemente su economía gracias a la ayuda que la fundación le está brindando. A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza, pero igualmente está consciente de que este trabajo y esfuerzo que está haciendo debe ser continuo y permanente para lograr un éxito total, ya que con ello podrá dar un mejor bienestar a su familia. 
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de verduras para surtir su negocio y para obtener  mayor venta, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos
texts.en:
The communal bank "Virgen del Rosario" is in its seventh loan cycle in the women's program.  They have taken the poverty elimination survey and most of the members have passed the 50 indicators on the survey and are trying to get ahead.

One of the members is Lucila and her survey results showed she is at level 3 on the poverty line.  She has been able to improve her economy significantly thanks to the support of the foundation.  Through her effort and continuous work, and by applying techniques for being a successful woman, she is improving her poverty situation.
