texts.es: Carmen de 61 años de edad, desde hace 20 años aprendió a ser comerciante; ella vendiendo pequeños artículos entre sus familiares y amigos empezó a construír su propio capital de trabajo;tambien mediante la observación aprendió a desarrollar el arte de la costura de ropa, e inició haciendo vestidos a su pequeño grupo de familia y de amigos, los cuales poco a poco se convirtieron en su mercado principal y llevaron la vocería en materia promocional lo que la ayudó a crear nuevos  nuevos mercados. Muy pronto su negocio fue creciendo y  su capital de trabajo también fue siendo más exigente, para poder responder a la demanda de sus compradores, por eso debió acceder a financiación de su cartera de ventas a crédito. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, segunda solicitud que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  mediante el cual con una parte  comprará, telas en mayor volumen para ganar descuentos especiales y aumentar su producción de ropa y también comprará con la otra parte de dinero, cremas y perfumería, que su clientela le ha encargado y debe responderle muy oportunamente, para fortalecer su oferta y así hacer del credikiva su mejor y mas exitosa inversión.
texts.en:
Carmen is 61 years old and 20 years ago she learned to be a merchant.  She sells small items to her family and friends began building her own working capital. She also learned through observation and developed the skills of a seamstress, so she started making dresses for her small group of family and friends. Gradually, they became her main market and led them to recommend her which helped her to expand her market.  

Her business quickly grew and its need for working capital was also becoming more demanding.  In order to meet the demands of her buyers, she had access to a loan to finance her line of credit.  Currently she applying for a Kiva loan, this will be her second loan through the Santo Domingo Foundation. With a part of the loan she will buy wholesale fabrics to get greater volume discounts and increase production and with the other part of the money she will buy creams and cosmetics. Her customers have placed orders with her and she must respond very promptly to strengthen her offerings and thus make Kiva loan her best and most successful investment.

loans.use: use some of the loan to buy wholesale fabrics and with the other part of the money, she will buy creams and cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: as working capital to enable her to place larger orders for clothing

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 35 years old, married, and lives in Likoni, Kenya with her husband and her two children. She is very hardworking and is always setting a good example. Their major monthly expenditures are rent and school fee payments.

She owns a clothes stall where she buys and sells secondhand clothes, a business she has been doing for two years now. It has given her good experience and widened her customers' range. She has asked for a loan amounting to KES 25,000 so she can stock her stall and buy a bundle of clothes.

loans.use: to stock her stall and buy a bundle of clothes.

loans.name: Naser

texts.en: Naser is a 20-year-old single man. He has three brothers. Naser is a university student majoring in hotel management. He is applying for an educational loan that will help him in paying the upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his next semester fees.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is a married business lady and owns a retail shop selling used and new electronics/electricals. The business also carries out electronics repairs. 

She started the business from the income she received from her former employment. Judith also keeps poultry.

Judith learnt about Milango through friends who invited her to the group, and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenge is the bad debts. 

Judith is applying for a loan of 83,500 Kenya shillings to buy radios, sockets, cables, televisions, etc. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to purchase more stock. 

Her desire is also to keep layers (hens) in the near future.

loans.use: to buy radios, sockets, cables, televisions, etc.

loans.name: Elena

texts.ru:
Елена  - фермер. С 2010 года занимается выращиванием столовых сортов винограда.
Справляться по хозяйству ей помогает муж.
Развитие деятельности начиналось с выращивания молодых саженцев винограда.
Елена с мужем решила приобрести опрыскиватель т.к вручную опрыскивать большую площадь виноградника очень тяжело.
В планах на будущие:  расширить посадку новых сортов винограда, поставить теплицы. 
В личных планах: на будущее достроить дом для жилья.
Нуждается в вашей помощи для финансирования опрыскивателя для виноградника.
texts.en: Elena is a farmer.  Since 2010, she has grown different kinds of grapes.  Her husband helps care for the business.    With her husband, Elena decided to buy a sprayer since spraying the crops by hand over a large area is very difficult.  When it comes to the future, Elena plans to start planting new varieties, and to build a greenhouse.  She would also like to build a home.  She needs your help to finance the purchase of a sprayer.

loans.use: To purchase farming equipment

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar is a conservative woman, so she asked her daughter to take her place in the photo.

Recently, Sahar’s husband retired and is now receiving a governmental retirement salary, and Sahar is still working in the public sector. 

Previously, Sahar applied for a loan to support her daughter, Nojoud, who is studying at the university. Now she is applying for another loan to continue supporting her daughter and pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s semester fees.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is 28 years old, single and has two older sisters. He has a business in which he mainly sews bed covers and curtains. He is applying for a 1000 JOD youth loan from National Microfinance Bank to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.use: buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Ramata  Bouna

texts.fr:
Agée de 32 ans, madame Ramata Bouna fait du commerce depuis 5 ans. Elle est mère de 4 enfants dont le plus âgé a 15 ans et le cadet, 8 ans. Son activité consiste à vendre du poisson frais. Elle part se ravitailler chez les piroguiers pour venir revendre dans le marché local. Elle se lève tôt vers 6h du matin et à 14h, elle a déjà fini sa journée. Il faut noter que puisqu’elle n’a pas de chambre froide elle fait tout pour vite écouler sa marchandise.
Elle n’a pas de charges familiales sinon ses propres besoins ; son bénéfice est donc reversé dans l’activité. Pour maximiser son profit, elle veut se lancer dans le futur dans la vente de produits cosmétiques.
texts.en:
At age 32, Mrs. Ramata Bouna has been in business for five years.  She is the mother of four children, the oldest of whom is 15 and the youngest is eight.  Her business is selling fresh fish.   She goes to get her fresh batch from the boatmen and comes back to sell them at the local market.  She gets up early, around 6 am, and by 2 pm she has finished her day.  It should be noted that since she has no refrigerator, she does all she can to move her merchandise quickly.
She has no family responsibilities except her own personal needs; her profits are therefore reinvested in her business. To maximize her profits, she wants to take on cosmetic sales in the future.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish to sell.

loans.name: Gabriel Miguel

texts.es: El Sr. Gabriel   tiene 18 años,  se dedica  a la actividad de la carpintería, el vive en la localidad de El Torno,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Gabriel   va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de una motocicleta ya que esto le permitirá movilizarse de manera rápida a su trabajo ya que son distancias largas que tiene que recorrer,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es ahorrar en pasajes ya que el tener una motocicleta le permitirá ahorra dinero, el  Sr. Gabriel   va a utilizar los beneficios en comprar Herramientas para su trabajo ya que las que tiene se le están gastando y necesita renovar para realizar un mejor trabajo, El Sr. Gabriel   es una persona joven muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada  en la otorgación del crédito ya que esta es su única  actividad que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en:
Gabriel is 18 years old and works as a carpenter. He lives in the town of El Torno. This loan is his first with the institution.

Gabriel will use this loan to buy a motorcycle, which will help him get to work more quickly as he has a long way to travel. He is asking for the loan because having a motorcycle will let him save money on fares. Gabriel will use these savings to buy tools for his work, since those that he has already are getting worn out and need to be replaced so that he can do a better job.

Gabriel is a very hardworking young man and feels happy about the opportunity provided by this loan, since his job is the only activity that allows him to support himself.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Rusudan

texts.en:
Rusudan is 65 years old and lives with her husband in the village of Mchadijvari. She and her husband run a small-scale dairy business; in particular, they produce cheese which they sell locally. The family’s income is supplemented by both the rent they receive from a flat they own in the capital city and her retirement pension.

Rusudan and her life partner work hard to save, but they still don’t have enough money to improve their living conditions. Rusudan is very grateful for Kiva lenders and Credo, as she has been offered a 2000 GEL loan that will allow her to buy construction materials such as cement, iron, sand, bricks, etc. In this way, the couple will be able to build a bathroom for her house.

With this loan Rusudan and her husband will upgrade their home so they can enjoy living in it and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to build a bathroom.

loans.name: Layla

texts.en:
Layla is a 53-year-old married woman with two daughters. She operates a sewing business at home to help supplement her family’s income.

Layla is now applying for a 1000 JOD loan from National Microfinance Bank to buy more fabric and material. She hopes to increase her production.

loans.use: to buy more fabric and material

loans.name: Rosa Dolores

texts.es: Rosa de 57 años de edad se dedica a la elaboración de prendas de vestir, especialmente de uniformes. En sus 37 años de experiencia ha sabido sostener su negocio y con creó la forma de generar  ingresos, con los que desde que formó su propia familia pudo apoyar en los gastos de su hogar. Su idea de negocio  nació después de haber aprendido el oficio, realizando cursos donde aprendió las tareas de corte y confección, iniciando primero, con la fabricación de vestidos infantiles, posterior de quinceañeros y de ropa en general además de arreglos. Hoy su principal producto es el  uniforme  escolar, que comercializa directamente, mediante convenios con instituciones educativas. En su esquema de mercadeo sus instituciones educativas, que son sus principales clientes le adelantan el 50% del costo del número de productos a elaborar, y el otro 50%  una vez entregue la totalidad del contrato.  Rosa también tiene clientes individuales a los que les vende a crédito y sus operaciones las desempeña de lunes a domingos. En la actualidad Rosa ha recibido 9 financiamientos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual ha comprado maquinarias, materias primas e insumos, con los cuales ha mejorado sus tiempos productivos, e incrementado su capital de trabajo. Su meta es ampliar su taller, generando más empleos a operarias, para finalmente remodelar su vivienda y lograr con su trabajo persistente, esfuerzo y dedicación todos sus sueños. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará telas para confeccionar uniformes escolares que tiene encargados y para lo que requiere complementar el otro 50% para dar cumplimento a su contrato de manera oportuna.
texts.en:
Rosa, 57 years old, makes clothing, especially uniforms. In her 37 years of experience she has known how to sustain her business and created a way to earn income with which she started her own family and could support the household expenses.

The idea to start her own business was born after she learned the trade, taking courses where she learned tailoring and dressmaking, starting first making children’s clothing, and later for teenagers and clothing in general plus mending.

Today her main product is school uniforms that she sells directly, through contracts with educational institutions. Her marketing arrangement with educational institutions, who are her main customers, is that they advance 50% of the cost of the number of products to be made, and the other 50% when she delivers the entire order.

Rosa also has individual customers to whom she offers credit and her business is done from Monday through Sunday. At the moment Rosa has received 9 loans through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, through which she has bought machines, staples and supplies, with which she has improved her turnaround and increased her working capital.

Her goal is to expand her workshop, creating more jobs for employees, and lastly to remodel her home and to succeed through her persistent work, effort, and dedication to all her dreams.

Currently she is applying for a Kiva loan, in order to buy fabric to make school uniforms for the orders she has which require finishing the other 50% in order to complete the contract in a timely manner.

loans.use: to buy fabric in larger quantity

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en:
Lusine is 28 years old and married. She is a philologist, or a linguist who studies written texts. She is a teacher at one of Vanadzor’s schools. Her husband is a physics teacher at another school.

Besides teaching in the local schools, the couple also teaches mathematics and physics privately in the living room of their house. But they find this arrangement too impractical and uncomfortable and are building a new room to be used as a classroom.

Lusine is applying for a 500,000 AMD loan from Nor Horizon to buy a computer and printer plus new desks and chairs for their new classroom. This will help them provide a more comfortable environment for their students and upgrade their enterprise.

loans.use: to buy a computer and printer plus new desks and chairs.

loans.name: Adelaida Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Adelaida vive en la cuidad de Boaco sus labores empiezan a las 2 am de la mañana alistando su mercadería y se traslada desde  su tierra natal a la capital  para ofertar sus productos, tiene una pequeña fabrica donde producen queso y crema de manera artesanal en su casa de habitación y lo trae ala capital para comercializarlo en los mercado de la capital.

 Esta solicitando el crédito para la compra de leche para la elaboración de sus productos  ya que con el verano  la leche aumenta sus costos.

por medio de este negocio ella les da son el sustento de sus pequeños hijos. Pero también se beneficia  las personal que ella le vende su producto en los mercado 
Para que los comercialicen y de esta manera ella se siente bien por que manifiesta que su trabajo les genera ingreso a muchas personas.
texts.en:
Adelaida lives in the city of Boaco. She begins work at 2 am, getting her merchandise ready, and she travels from her home to the capital to sell her products. She has a small factory in her home where cheese and cream are produced using traditional methods. She brings these products to the capital to sell them in the markets.

She is asking for this loan to buy milk to make her products, because now that it is summer, milk is driving up her costs.

She supports her two small children with her business. This business also benefits the people who buy the products in the markets and then re-sell them. She feels good about it because her work helps to provide income for many people.

loans.use: to buy milk.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es: El Sr. Reynaldo  tiene 38 años, casado con dos hijos que tienen las edades de 14 y 10 años,  el se dedica  a la elaboración y  venta de queso y leche ya que tiene ganado vacuno, el vive en la localidad de Pantini, la gente de la población se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  El Sr. Reynaldo utilizara  este préstamo para la compra  de una vaca lechera y quiere aprovechar esta oportunidad,  Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es no tiene dinero  para la compra ya que esto le beneficiara de gran manera  ya que  proporcionara  buena cantidad de leche y así de esta manera producir más quesos y leche y mejorar sus ingresos económicos, El Sr. Reynaldo enfrenta retos en su negocio que son el forraje que debe comprar cada cierto tiempo, y  utilizara los beneficios mejorar su ganado y su deseo es poder elaborar quesos por mayor y ofrecer a los distintos mercados de la ciudad de La Paz.
texts.en:
Sr. Reynaldo is 38 years old, married and has two children, who are 14 and 10 years old. He prepares and sells cheese and milk because he owns cattle. He lives in the town of Patini, where the inhabitants engage in agriculture and livestock raising. This is his first loan cycle in his communal bank. 

Sr. Reynaldo will use this loan to purchase a dairy cow and he wants to take advantage of this opportunity. The reason he is requesting a loan is because he lacks the money to make this purchase and it will greatly benefit him since the cow will provide a good quantity of milk and he will be able to produce more milk and cheese and improve his earnings.

Sr. Reynaldo faces challenges in his business such as fodder, which he needs to buy every now and then and he will use his profits to improve his cattle. He wants to be able to produce cheese wholesale and sell to the different markets in the city of la Paz.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: El Sr. Edwin tiene 24 años y es casado, el  se dedica a la venta de ganado, el vende en las distintas ferias de la ciudad de  El Alto, el vive en la localidad de Karuiza,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Edwin va a usar este préstamo para la compra un camión para llevar a las distintas ferias su ganado para la venta, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital, El Sr. Edwin enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la poca demanda en ocasiones ya sea por problemas de clima o de transporte, desea con el tiempo poder comprar en mayor cantidad ganado.
texts.en:
Edwin is 24 years old and married, and works selling livestock. He sells in the different cattle markets in the city of El Alto, and lives in the community of Karuiza. 

This loan is his first with the institution. Edwin will use this loan to buy a truck to bring his livestock to different cattle markets to sell. He is asking for the loan because he needs capital. The challenge that Edwin faces in his business is low demand at times, be it due to problems with the weather or transportation. In time he wants to be able to buy livestock in greater quantities.

loans.use: to buy a truck.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a 35-year-old, hardworking lady who is married with two children. She lives in Likoni, Kenya where she has a clothing stall where she sells second hand clothing.
She has operated this business for the last two year. This has helped her gain a lot of experience. She has also been able to get a wide variety of consumers. Her major monthly expense is school payments.
She has requested a loan in the amount of 40,000 KES to reinvest in her stall and buy two bundles of second hand clothing. She is grateful for such an opportunity and believes that this will enhance her business hence improving her living standards.

loans.use: to reinvest in her stall and buy two bundles of second hand clothing.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 63 years old and lives with her husband in the village of Nakhakhulevi. Both of the family members receive retirement pensions. Nora and her husband are involved in a small scale dairy business. In particular, they own three milk cows and produce cheese which is sold locally. In addition, they grow nuts on family-owned land. According to the government's estimations, the family belongs in the vulnerable poor category, and they get monthly social assistance. Nora’s husband works as a watchman and also gets a small monthly salary.
Nora and her life partner work hard to save, but they still don’t have enough income to improve their living conditions. Nora is very grateful for Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, she will be able to buy construction supplies such as cement, iron, sand, bricks, etc. She will be able to renovate her house and improve her quality of life. Nora and her husband can create suitable home conditions so that they can enjoy living in their house.

loans.use: to renovate her house.

loans.name: Armando

texts.es: Armando es un joven agricultor padre de dos niños, desde muy pequeño se dedica a la agricultura, exclusivamnete a la cosecha de café, necesita un crédito de trescientos cincuenta mil colones (¢350.000) para comprar abonos, herbicidas y plaguicidas para darle mantenimiento a su cafetal,de esta manera lo protege de plagas, hongos y otras enfermedades,  Armando nos comenta que del buen mantenimiento que le de a su cafetal depende la producción que obtendrá, por eso hace su mejor esfuerzo por lograrlo.
texts.en: Armando is a young farmer and the father of two children.  He has been farming and exclusively harvesting coffee since he was very young.  He needs a loan in the amount of ¢350,000 to buy compost, herbicides, and blight chemicals to maintain his coffee crop.  In this way he can protect it from blights and other disease.  Armando tells us that his crop’s production depends on the maintenance he give his fields.  This is why he gives maximum effort.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es:
Maximiliana de 55 años, es una madre soltera. Vive con su único hijo Maycon en una casa propia ubicada en un barrio agrícola.Ella tiene mucho coraje y fuerza para el trabajo duro. Supo sacar adelante a su hijo quien ahora es mayor y la ayuda en sus labores del campo. Ella es una mujer agricultora y a su edad ya sabe como funciona el negocio. Los productos que con tanto esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado cultivar le han ayudado mucho en el progreso de su vida. Su trabajo inicia desde antes que salga el sol, cuidando a sus animales pues también cría: cuyes, gallinas, toros y ovejas; luego se dirige a limpiar y cuidar sus cultivos.Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es atender sus tierras y se siente bien al ver sus arvejas, habas, maíz, papas y hortalizas crecer sanas.
“Cuando cosecho vendo mis productos en el mercado mayorista de Tarma”, comenta y a su vez espera mejorar sus productos, para así poder obtener mayores ganacias.
Ahora se encuentra en la preparación de un terreno para sembrar maíz, por ello requiere de su ayuda.
Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Muruhuay” y éste sería su crédito número 6 con MFP. Está dispuesta a pagar con puntualidad las cuotas mensuales. En su banco comunal es una socia muy solidaria y colaboradora.Con los 2500 soles podrá comprar semillas de maíz, y varias bolsas de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Maximiliana is 55 years old and is a single mother.  She lives with her only son, Maycon, in her own home located in a farming neighborhood.  She has lots of courage and effort for hard work.  She knew how to get her son ahead and he helps her with her farm work.  She is a farmer and at her age she knows how the business works.  The products that she has raised with so much effort and dedication have helped her in her life.  Her work begins before the sun comes up, caring for her animals.  She also raises Guinea pigs, chickens, bulls, and sheep.  The she goes out to clean and care for her crops.  What she likes most about her work is tending to her land and she feels good watcher her peas, beans, corn, potatoes, and vegetables grow healthily.

“When I harvest, I sell my products in the main market in Tarma,” she says, and she hopes to improve her products so that she can obtain better earnings.

Now she is preparing to plant corn and needs your help.  She is a member of the “Señor de Muruhuay” communal bank and this will he her sixth loan through MFP.  She is prepared to make her monthly payments on schedule.  She is very cooperative in her communal bank.  She will use the 2,500 PEN from this loan to buy corn seeds and bags of compost.

loans.use: to buy seeds and compost.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Luzmila tiene 33 años, convive con Freddy con quien tiene 2 hijos: Brayan y Cielo. Su casa es alquilada y se ubica en un anexo agrícola.
Luzmila, a pesar de cuidar a su pequeña hija, no descuida sus labores. Cuando Luzmila tenía 17 años se inició en la agricultura. Ya tenía ciertos conocimientos ya que sus padres se dedican a esta actividad. Sus principales sembríos constan de arvejas, habas,  maíz y demás hortalizas. Con la ayuda de su esposo  puede abarcar todo el trabajo sacrificado que es cuidar sus sembríos. “Bellavista es una zona que produce buenos choclos (maíz tierno) por eso la mayoría de compradores llegan hasta ahí”, comenta orgullosa. Por su parte, Fredy  también se dedica al servicio de transporte entre los distrito de Tarma y Palca. De esa manera pueden abastecer sus gastos principales, y más aún con los gastos escolares de sus hijos. Luzmila acaba de cosechar un lote de maíz y le fue bien, espera lo mismo de otros lotes, para ello requiere de su ayuda, para adquirir abono orgánico por esta razon solicitará 600 soles para la compra del mismo.
texts.en:
Luzmila is 33 years old, lives with Freddy and has two children, Brayan y Cielo.  She lives in a rented house located in the agricultural zone.

Luzmila, despite caring for her daughter, does not neglect her work.  She was 17 years old when she began farming.  She already had certain knowledge that she learned from her parents who also farmed.  Her main crops are peas, beans, corn and other vegetables.  With her husband’s help she is able to do all of her work and care for her crops.  “Bellavista is a zone that produces good choclo (soft corn), so most of the buyers go there,” she proudly states.  Fredy also provides transportation services in and around the Tarma and Palca districts.  In this way they can provide for their main expenses and also for their children’s educational expenses.  Luzmila just finished harvesting a lot of corn and things went well for her.  She expects the same from the other lots and needs your help for that so that she can buy compost.  She is asking for a loan in the amount of 600 PEN.

loans.use: to buy compost.

loans.name: Shienyu Ni Shienyu Group

texts.en:
Monica is pictured on the right with her hand raised among her Shienyu ni Shienyu Group members. The twelve members, nine women and three men, are farmers in Kakamega South District. Farming inputs consisting of the materials necessary to plant half an acre of maize, millet, and sorghum will be delivered to her on credit. Monica joined One Acre Fund during the "long rains" season of 2010 and is now enrolling for the 2013 "long rains" season. Monica joined One Acre Fund so that she could gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and access the best input prices.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Monica was only able to harvest two bags of maize per half acre, but after joining One Acre Fund, she was able to harvest eight bags per half acre during the "long rains" of 2012. She plans to use her profits from the harvest to send her children to school and save for the future. For the 2013 "long rains" season, Monica’s group members will each take part of the loan to plant on half an acre of land. In total, this group will receive a loan for enough inputs to use on six acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Rosette

texts.en: Rosette is married and has four children, three of whom attend school. She does not take care of additional family members. She has a business selling charcoal. She has been in this business for seven years, selling to all categories of people on a retail basis. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She works in a shop that she rents seven days a week.  Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to buy a delivery van for easier transportation. She resides in a rented house; the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, school fees, and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Nzalambi

texts.en:
Nzalambi is 51 years old and has been married to her husband, Chagamba, for years. She has five children, all of whom are adults.

Nzalambi has run a kiosk for three years, and thanks her husband, who works as a businessman, for his help. Together they help one another with the family expenses. 

She is asking for this loan to buy noodles, flour, cooking oil, herbs, cookies, cassava, drinks and candy to stock in her store. Nzalambi will then offer a greater variety to her customers and be able to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy noodles, flour, cooking oil, herbs, cookies, cassava, drinks and candy to sell in her kiosk.

loans.name: Baraka Group

texts.en:
Mika is a member of the Baraka Group, which has 16 farmers in total and is located in Kakamega South District, Kenya. Mika is pictured on the right with his hand raised.  He will receive input loans capable of planting a half of an acre with sorghum, millet, and maize. Mika first enrolled with the One Acre Fund during the 2012 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Mika joined to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and grow enough food for the family.

Mika reports that he grew about a bag of maize per acre in past seasons, but with his One Acre Fund input loan last year, he harvested 13 bags per 1 ½ acre. He hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send his children to school and to repair his home. For this coming season, each group member will receive a half of an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Mika’s group will receive eight acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Shee

texts.en:
Shee is a married man who lives with his wife and nine children in the village of Mwambalazi. Before he started his store, Shee raised livestock and was able to accumulate a significant amount of capital. He built his house and decided to open a store with their savings. Thanks to his effort and hard work, the business has expanded. Shee now has a steady clientele because of the good and friendly service he provides to his customers.

Shee is requesting a loan to purchase supplies for his store, such as beverages, groceries, vegetables and other products.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for his store such as beverages, groceries, vegetables and other products.

loans.name: Willinton

texts.es: Wilinton  de 28 años de edad se dedica  ala elaboración de pizzas y jugos, experiencia que adquirió hace 6 años, cuando trabajó para el propietario de ese mismo negocio, que le fue vendido por su propietario,  al ver la responsabilidad propia de Willington; Hoy que ha organizado su hogar del cual existe un hijo de 3 años de edad y ha logrado sostener su microempresa  con mucho trabajo, pues es dedicado, tiene un puesto donde llegan sus clientes, compran diariamente los insumos para elaborar productos de pizzería y jugos naturales, con los cuales deleita a su clientela. En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará salsas, cárnicos, un carrito para transportar arepas . Sus principales clientes son sus vecinos, gran parte de los cuales provienen de su pueblo natal y son fieles a él, pues trabaja efectivamente con el fin de lograr impactarlos. Su meta mas adelante es adquirir una casa ´propia manteniendo su fuente de ingresos que es muy apropiada para alcanzar sus metas, pero eso si haciéndolo crecer cada vez mas.
texts.en:
Wilinton is 28 years old. He works making pizzas and juices. He has six years experience. He learned when he worked for the owner of the same business, which was sold to him by its owner, upon seeing Willington’s sense of duty. 

Today he has started his own household and he has a three year old son and has managed to sustain his micro-enterprise with a lot of hard work. He is dedicated. He has a stand where customers visit. He buys supplies daily in order to make pizza and natural juices, which pleases his customers.

Currently he is asking for a Kiva loan, his first financing being made through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in order to buy salsas, meat, and a cart to transport tortillas.

His main clients are neighbors, many of who come from his hometown and are faithful to him, as he works energetically in order to successfully influence them. His goal for the future is to buy his own house, maintaining income that is adequate in order to achieve his goals, and by doing this to grow more and more.

loans.use: to buy salsas, meat, and a cart to transport tortillas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more items like cement and nails to sell.

loans.name: Bakari

texts.en:
Bakari is a single man from the village of Mwambalazi. He is the owner of a store in his private house and he has regular customers. He also makes deliveries door to door. He sells coconuts. He is a hard worker whose goal is to be able to continue growing to be able to continue helping his family and to take care of the day to day expenses.

He is requesting this loan to be able to purchase supplies for his store and thus continue working and earning more.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for his store.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is 39 years old, married and a mother of four children. She operates a tailoring shop in Malindi town and has been in the business for the last seven years. Mwanaisha earns a monthly profit of 4,600 KES. 

She was introduced to KADET  by a credit officer, and she is applying for her second loan of 43,000 KES. She intends to use the loan to buy clothing materials and also to pay for her child's school fees as she prepares to sit for her final exams this year. 

In the future, Mwanaisha hopes to grow her tailoring shop into a full boutique for the area.

loans.use: to buy clothing materials and to pay for her child's school fees.

loans.name: Hidaya

texts.en:
Hidaya is a 34-year-old hardworking lady married to Hamadi and blessed with two children, a boy and a girl, who are both in school. Their major monthly expenditures are school fees and rent. She earns her living through buying and selling clothes from house to house, a business that she has been running for the last two years. This has enabled her to cater to customers and have her own share in the competitive business.

Due to growth of her customer base, there is a need to open her own stall to reduce the cost of moving from house to house and instead reinvest on the business. To buy a bundle of cloth is why she approached Yehu where she has been a member for more than a year now. She is requesting a loan amounting to 25,000 KES. She is grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to open her own stall.

loans.name: Daniela

texts.es: La Sra. Daniela  tiene 33 años, tiene tres hijos de las edades de 1, 5  y 8 años, ella se dedica a la venta de rellenos Benianos que son  un bocadito que generalmente se sirve  a media mañana, ella vende  en su puesto de venta que se encuentra  en la zona de Satélite  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Daniela  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de un frízer y mantener refrigerados sus productos,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio. La Sra. Daniela  es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantener a su familia.
texts.en: Daniela is 33 years old.  She has three children, ages 1, 5 and 8.  She works selling “rellenos Benianos” which are a snack generally served in the mid-morning.  She sells in her stall that is located in the Satélite area.  This loan is her first sequence within the institution.  Daniela is going to use this loan to purchase a freezer and to keep her products refrigerated.  Her reason for applying for this loan is to continue improving in her business.  Daniela is a very hardworking person.  She feels happy for the opportunity offered to her since this is the only activity that allows her to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer.

loans.name: Claribel

texts.es: Claribel de 49 años de edad vive en Puerto Colombia, municipio ubicado a orillas del mar, con su esposo y sus dos hijos en las edades de 29 y 30 años. Desde hace 4 años se dedica al comercio, actividad con la que genera ingresos que apoyan el bienestar de su familia. Sus principales productos son los cosméticos de diversas marcas pues trabaja mediante el sistema de catálogos, es decir hace sus promociones con 4 guías especializadas de productos provenientes de multinacionales con las que establece sus relaciones comerciales. En su estrategia aborda el mercado de Puerto Colombia y también tiene clientes en la ciudad e Barranquilla ubicada a 20 minutos, ella para entregar el producto solicita el 50% y da crédito por el resto del valor de los productos que cada cliente escoja, teniendo en cuenta un plan de pagos que establece con cada uno, no mayor a 30 días. Gradualmente sus solicitudes de pedidos se incrementan especialmente en las temporadas especiales, como la que ocurre próximamente, cuando celebraron las familias el día de la madres. En su casa siempre cuenta con un inventario de productos que más rotan, para que sus clientes cuando le soliciten no se vayan con las manos vacías, pues siempre aprovecha las ofertas que traen las revistas, para impactar su mercado. Entre sus metas está el de organizar un pequeño almacén y por esto ha planeado su credikiva, segundo financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el primer financiamiento compró una vitrina metálica para organizar su inventario y productos que han sido solicitado por su clientela, como perfumes, accesorios femeninos, artículos de bisutería etc. La razón de éxito de su inversión es su gran experiencia, la oportunidad de comprar promociones en mayores cantidades, y que la realiza  justamente en una temporada donde las ventas se incrementan por efecto de los días especiales como los carnavales, por eso acude a un credikiva con el comprará colonias, perfumes cremas, cosméticos, desodorantes, ropa interior femenina
texts.en:
Claribel, 49 years old, lives in Puerto Colombia, a municipality located on the shores of the sea, with her husband and their two children who are 29 and 30 years old.  For four years she has made a living in commerce, an activity with which she generates income that supports the well-being of her family.  Her main products are various brands of cosmetics as she works through a system of catalogues, that is to say she makes her promotions with 4 specialized product guides coming from multinational companies with which she establishes her business relations.  In her strategy she deals with the market of Puerto Colombia and also she has customers in the city of Barranquilla, located 20 minutes away.  In order to deliver the products she requests 50% and gives credit for the rest of the value of the products that each customer chooses, taking into account a payment plan that she establishes with each one, not exceeding 30 days.  Gradually, her requests for orders increases, particularly in the special seasons, like the one which occurs soon, when families celebrate Mothers' Day.  In her house she always has an inventory of the products that rotate more, so that her clients, when they ask her for something, aren’t leaving empty-handed.  She always takes advantage of the offers that the magazines carry, in order to have an impact on her market.  

Among her goals is that of organizing a small storehouse and for this she has planned her Kiva loan, her second financing made from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With the first financing she bought a metal display cabinet to organize her inventory and products that have been requested by her clientele, such as perfumes, feminine accessories, items of costume jewelry, etc.  The reason for the success of her investment is her great experience, the opportunity to purchase special offers in greater quantities and that she makes them precisely in the season where the sales are increased as a result of the special days like carnivals.  That is why she turns to a Kiva loan with which she will buy colognes, perfumes, creams, cosmetics, deodorants and feminine undergarments.

loans.use: to purchase colognes, perfumes, creams, cosmetics, deodorants and feminine undergarments.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is a married woman with three children. She describes herself as a focused woman. She operates a retail store where she sells clothing. Veronica has been involved in this business for five years with her primary customers being local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge is insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy clothing to sell. Her business goal is to run a boutique in five years. She hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell in her store.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is from Mwambalazi and is married with six children. She is the owner of a cafe selling drinks and has her own shop. She is a very hardworking, responsible and honest person.

Fatuma started with a small stand where she sold fast food such as dumplings, flat bread, sandwiches and other items, as well as ice and drinks in general.

Her dream was always to have a very spacious cafe so that she can offer good service to each one of her customers. Now, thanks to her efforts, and also the help that Yehu Microfinance Trust offers, she has her own cafe.

She is applying for this loan in order to buy more products for her store. This way she can meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy more products for her store.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 51-year-old widower who lives with his son and daughter in Vanadzor, Armenia. Both of Robert’s children are students at the State Armenian Pedagogical University. Robert graduated from there, too, and worked as teacher for more than nine years. Robert had to change his occupation due to low teacher pay since he is the only bread winner. 

Robert has run his own business for ten years, selling foodstuffs and household goods trading in a rented place. He obtains a part of his merchandise from suppliers and another part he buys from Yerevan wholesale markets. 

With the profit Robert earns from his business, he cares for his family’s needs and pays his children’s tuition fees. Robert believes that the main contribution for any Armenian parent is for their children’s education. He does his best to provide a good future for his children. 

To increase his income, Robert needs a 300,000 AMD loan to add to his foodstuffs and household goods inventory.

loans.use: to purchase more foodstuffs and household goods to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Protasia

texts.en:
Protasia lives in the village of Mwambalazi. She is married and has three children. She is the owner of a well-stocked general store which she has had for over seven years. It is worth noting that she works with her whole family, and it is going very well. Thanks to this business and the work of the entire family, they have been able to grow considerably and are continuing to grow. They want to be able to expand their shop until they have a large supermarket where they might offer greater variety and comfort to their customers.

Protasia is seeking this loan for the purchase of drinks, bakery items, vegetables, fruits, meat and other products in order to be able to keep providing a good variety to her customers since that is what draws them the most.

loans.use: to purchase drinks, bakery items, vegetables, fruits, meat and other products.
